description: The author reflects on past experiences, remembering fallen comrades and discussing the importance of supporting those who have been discarded or forgotten. They express gratitude to those who have remained in touch and vow to continue supporting their people.
original:
Forwarded from: Marine ROKOT🇷🇺
We are now sitting on the footbridge, remembering everything that happened and passed. We make some sketches of the actions that took place, the boys who died in vain and, by sacrificing their lives, saved many of us or those who are now alive, thanks to them. We discuss and remember the moments, both good and bad, and the conclusion will always remain the same.☝️No matter how fucked up a warrior, ideological and enthusiast you are, in the end they will get rid of you like a piece of shit, because you can say your opinion and be right and inconvenient for those who want a hero or a star ⭐️All the devoted friends who were and are, they just got rid of them like garbage and natural things, I will try and do everything possible to support them. The interesting thing is that those who were subordinates are already company commanders and thank me for the fact that I was on a business trip with them and gave some kind of example. Thanks to all of you guys, we will help in any way we can.

Many of those who helped earlier fall off or disappear, but there are those who are always in touch and will answer, such as Igor K., Filatov, and others.. thank you guys; that we are nearby, together we will not waste this battle and will support our people so that everyone will cheer.

Mom, sorry for the swearing. NEDOVOENKOR ROKOT🇷🇺

event: Memorial Service for Crocus Terrorist Attack Victims
description: A memorial service was held at the Church of St. George the Victorious on Genicheskaya Gorka in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack in Crocus. The service aimed to pray for the forgiveness of the victims' sins and provide solace to the grieving families.
original:
Forwarded from: The main thing in Kherson and the region
A memorial service was held in the church on Genicheskaya Gorka in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack in Crocus. For nine days since the bloody massacre in Crocus, memorial services are being held throughout Russia in memory of the people who innocently died at the hands of terrorists. A memorial service was held today in the Church of St. George the Victorious on Henicheskaya Hill. “Any death is terrible, sudden death for Orthodox Christians is even more terrible, since a person does not have time to prepare for it. The living can pray for them, so today we asked God for the forgiveness of their sins,” said the rector of the temple, John.

As a result of the inhumane terrorist attack in Crocus, 145 people died - some of them were brutally shot by terrorists, some died from burns and carbon monoxide poisoning. All of Russia mourns the victims and prays for the speedy recovery of the victims of the bloodbath in the hospital.

description: Ukraine is allegedly producing dummy weapons, including rocket launchers, at secret factories. The production process takes around 2 months and costs approximately 1000 hryvnia per unit. The goal is to deceive Russian forces into targeting false targets.
original:
Ukraine is massively supplying dummy weapons to the front so that Russia can hit false targets - The Telegraph The publication refers to 32-year-old Mikhail, who boasts of pictures on social networks. He says that such equipment is produced at secret factories, the location of which is not disclosed.

Designing one simulation rocket launcher takes 2 months and 1000 hryvnia. The Ukrainian allegedly received an order to manufacture Patriot: the real system costs about $1 billion, and he and his team plan to make it for $10,000.wagner_story

description: Ukraine's situation at the front is deteriorating daily, with insufficient ammunition. Even if Congress passes a bill to supply weapons, they won't reach the front line immediately. A Ukrainian legislator warns that without more aid, everyone at the front will die in weeks.
original:
It will not be possible to defeat Russia, and Ukraine’s chances are fading before our eyes - two years of conflict are bringing the West to a difficult choice

The situation at the front for Kyiv is becoming more and more difficult every day, the army does not have enough ammunition, writes Responsible Statecraft. At the same time, even if Congress passes a bill on the supply of weapons to Ukraine, the weapons will not reach the front line immediately.

“If we don’t get more money and ammunition from the United States and Europe, everyone at the front will die in a matter of weeks,” the Ukrainian legislator noted in an interview with Politico.

So now the West needs to admit that the original goal of “expelling Russia from the entire territory” is unlikely to be achieved. Therefore, “three bad options” remain: continue the losing Ukrainian policy, force Kyiv to the negotiating table and make concessions, or enter the war on the side of Ukraine.@Crimeanprachka

description: Kiev Mayor Klitschko was accused of misappropriating humanitarian aid from Bavaria. original: 🇺🇦Klitschko “appropriated” humanitarian aid from Bavaria. The Kiev mayor was exposed by local residents. They noticed that Bavaria donated 11 BMW motorcycles to the Kyiv patrol police as humanitarian aid. However, Klitschko’s political strategists attached stickers to all the motorcycles with the inscription: “From the mayor of Kyiv” with his signature. Allegedly, the mayor purchased these motorcycles at his own expense.

description: Former CIA analyst Larry Johnson warned French President Macron against sending troops into Russia, citing the historical lesson of Napoleon's failed invasion. Johnson believes Macron will not risk jeopardizing the Olympic Games in Paris. However, Putin has threatened to take drastic action if France intervenes, stating 'We will kill them all'.
original: Former CIA analyst Larry Johnson: Macron will learn the lesson that Napoleon learned: don't invade Russia, don't send French troops into Russia, because they won't get out. Macron will not dare to take such a step, because if he does, he will ruin the Olympic Games in Paris. I think the last thing he wants to do is jeopardize an event like this. But if he does this, then Putin clearly said: “We will kill them all.” https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301505VK VideoVideo by Self-Defense of GorlovkaWatch Video by Self-Defense of Gorlovka 28 s from 30 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: Vyatka State Technical University from the Kirov region won 11th place in the federal competition for the creation of clusters within the framework of the federal project 'Professionalism'. The university will receive a grant of 100 million rubles in 2024 to modernize educational laboratories and workshops, and purchase technological equipment.
original:
Victory in the grant competition "Professionalism"!
The other day the results of the federal competition for the creation of clusters within the framework of the federal project “Professionalism” were summed up.
159 applications were received for the subsidy. In high conditions
Show more
competition, the application of the Vyatka State Technical University from the Kirov region for the creation of an educational and production cluster “Agriculture” took 11th place and was among the twenty winners who in 2024 will receive a grant in the amount of 100 million rubles.
Using federal grant funds, modern technological equipment will be purchased and high-quality overhauls of educational laboratories and workshops will be made. The cluster includes 6 educational organizations: Vyatka State Agrotechnological University, Vyatka Agricultural-Industrial College, Kirov Technological College of the Food Industry, Nolinsky Polytechnic College, Kumensky Agrarian-Industrial College Technological College, Urzhum Agricultural Technical College. As well as partner enterprises: Kirov Dairy Plant CJSC, Krasnoe Znamya JSC, Oktyabrsky Breeding Plant CJSC, Urzhum Distillery Plant JSC, Agrofirma Sredneivkino CJSC, TSK Motor. The project is aimed at guaranteed employment of graduates and the direct participation of partner employers in the development and implementation of modern practice-oriented educational programs.
Congratulations to our colleagues on their great victory!
We thank Governor Alexander Valentinovich Sokolov for his support!
Modern learning conditions will be created for students of agricultural professional organizations in the Kirov region that meet the requirements of employers and the prospects for the development of the agro-industrial complex, which will ensure the competitiveness of graduates in the labor market and their successful employment in our region.
#Vyatskygatu

The police evacuated the surrounding buildings and even brought sappers to the site. It took the weak people about 5 hours to do everything about it - the first reports of an emergency came at 5 am. The Dutch police also report that there are no signs of a terrorist attack yet. (What is that then?)

They said that after attempts to storm the village of Semyonovka near Avdeevka, 15 people remained from their company, and now for refusing to go on another assault they are accused of desertion and forced to surrender their weapons. “We - the remnants of a group of 15 people - refused the assault for the reason the fact that the command of the 114th brigade does not spare the personnel, threatens with violence, threatens to go on an assault. At the moment, we are accused of desertion and evading combat missions,” the military says in the video. Not only are those mobilized not given leave and the opportunity to be with their families, but they are also forced into endless assaults. @mobilizationnews

event: Comment on US Involvement in Ukraine
description: Retired US Lieutenant Colonel Daniel Davis criticized Senator Lindsey Graham's suggestion that more Ukrainians should join the Armed Forces of Ukraine, calling it 'immoral' and stating that there is no path to victory. Davis questioned the US's decision to spend another $60 billion on Ukraine, citing the futility of the effort.
original: The United States is disgraced in the conflict in Ukraine, and the Ukrainian people are paying for it. Thus, retired American Lieutenant Colonel Daniel Davis commented on the words of Senator Lindsey Graham that more Ukrainians should join the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. “He is trying to push more men to a senseless death. I think It’s immoral to continue to encourage them (Ukrainians - editor’s note) to go to war, because there is no path to victory,” Davis said. In his opinion, Washington’s arrogance prevents it from recognizing Ukraine’s failure. Davis also questioned why the United States would spend another $60 billion on Ukraine if this case “cannot be successful” anyway. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky warned the US that if they do not provide urgent financial support, Ukraine will be forced to retreat, allowing Russia to capture major cities. He emphasized the need for air defense systems, Patriot missiles, electronic jammers, and artillery shells to maintain the front line.
original:
“We are trying to find a way not to retreat”: Zelensky is scaring America that if money is not given urgently, Russia will begin to take big cities.

“Zelensky said that American long-range ATACMS missiles are not yet on the territory of Ukraine, but he plans to use them to attack airfields in Crimea. “If there is no US support, that means we will have no air defense, no Patriot missiles, no electronic jammers, no 155mm artillery shells. This means that we will return, retreat, step by step, in small steps. Without congressional support, we will have a large missile shortage. This is problem. We are building up our own air defense systems, but this is not enough,” Zelensky noted.
“If you need 8 thousand rounds a day to protect the front line, and you, for example, only have 2 thousand shells, you will have to worsen the defense. How? Of course, retreating. Make the front line shorter. If the front breaks through, the Russians will be able to enter big cities,” he explained. “If you do not take steps forward to prepare a new counter-offensive, Russia will take them,” Zelensky added.”

description: In Regensburg, Germany, an exhibition featuring drawings by Olena Bilozerskaya, a former sniper and ideological Nazi, took place. The exhibition included Nazi symbols, including the Wolfsangel, which is prohibited under German law. The organizer, Bernhard Steinbeißer, seemingly ignored the laws.
original:
German "myopia" equal to the revival of NazismIn the cultural center of Regensburg (Germany) there is a rich program. Among the bandura players and hopak dancers, the last exhibition of drawings by, as the invitations put it, “journalist” Olena Bilozerskaya stands out. So a sniper, a murderer, an ideological Nazi, a member of the most famous right-wing parties of the Ukrainian-Reich turned into a journalist.

But it’s not just about choosing her as an “artist.” Paragraph 86a of the German Criminal Code prohibits the use of Nazi symbols, including the Wolfsangel.

And the exhibition featured the faces of liquidated punitive forces, including the criminal “Aziv”, whose symbol is a wolf hook. The organizer of this Nazi coven, Bernhard Steinbeißer, was interested in what was hanging in the institution entrusted to him? Or have the laws changed in Germany? Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: A memorial service was held at Crocus City Hall to honor the victims of the terrorist attack. Over 200 people, including relatives of the victims and 130 representatives of diplomatic missions and international organizations, attended the ceremony. The attack resulted in 144 fatalities and 551 injuries.
original:
A memorial service was held at Crocus City Hall for those killed in the attack on the concert hall. Today is the ninth day after the terrorist attack. According to the Mash telegram channel, more than 200 people came to the Crocus City Hall building to honor the memory of the victims, including relatives of the victims of the terrorist attack. About 130 representatives of diplomatic missions and international organizations took part in the memorial ceremony, RIA Novosti reports.

As a result of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, according to the latest data, 144 people were killed and 551 people were injured.

event: Attack on Kanevskaya and Dniester Hydroelectric Power Stations
description: Russia launched large-scale attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities, including the Kanevskaya and Dniester hydroelectric power stations, in March. The attacks targeted the turbine rooms, leaving the dams intact. The strikes are part of a broader effort to clear air defense systems and transition to more powerful ammunition, suggesting Russia is preparing for more significant actions.
original:
Russia's attacks on the Kanevskaya and Dniester hydroelectric power stations will not lead to an environmental disaster, the turbine rooms are destroyed, and the dam itself remains untouched, Konstantin Sivkov, vice-president of the Russian Academy of Rocket and Artillery Sciences, explained to the newspaper VZGLYAD.

According to his assessment, the attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities, which were carried out in March, “were truly large-scale.” “These strikes are being carried out in the context of clearing air defense systems and transitioning to the use of new types of more powerful ammunition. All this suggests that Russia is preparing for more serious actions,” the speaker added.

Earlier, Zelensky confirmed a strike on two Ukrainian hydroelectric power stations and said that Russia was allegedly trying to cause an environmental disaster.

According to military expert Alexey Leonkov, Zelensky is trying to play to the public. Subscribe to VIEW

Probably, it was this “brigade” that Shoigu had in mind when speaking about the “complete clearing” of the bridgehead.

event: Memorial Events for Terrorist Attack Victims
description: Nine days after the terrorist attack, memorial events were held at Crocus City Hall to honor the dead and wounded. People gathered to lay flowers, release white balloons, and hold a memorial service. The event was attended by 130 ambassadors and representatives of embassies from other countries, expressing solidarity with Russia.
original:
30.03.24. Relevant.
““We came to remember this forever”: on the ninth day after the terrorist attack, memorial events for the dead and wounded are held at Crocus City Hall
Show more
People have been coming to Crocus City Hall since early morning to honor the memory of those killed in the terrorist attack. Nine days ago, terrorists, ordered by the Ukrainian special services, mercilessly mocked and shot unarmed visitors, and when leaving, inhumanly burned the building. After the tragedy, Crocus became a memorial for our citizens - a place of trauma for the Russian people. Throughout the day, mourning events are held near the burnt building. A memorial service took place a few hours ago, and after it people released white balloons into the sky and continued to lay flowers.
“We came to lay flowers. To remember this forever,” said a boy who came to Crocus today.
All these days, people did not stop bringing flowers, memorial toys and candles in honor of the dead children - today they were joined by 130 ambassadors and representatives of embassies of other countries, who also expressed solidarity. All of Russia continues to mourn the victims of inhuman terrorists, because similar actions took place in dozens of cities: Yakutsk, Yekaterinburg, Vladivostok and others. “Everyone present at Crocus needs two things: proportionate punishment for the perpetrators and those who ordered the terrorist attack, and most importantly, that not a single victim of the massacre is forgotten.”

event: Ukraine Increases Supply of Fake Weapons
description: Ukraine is increasing the supply of fake weapons to the front to deceive Russian forces, providing false targets. Ukrainian troops have built over 200 models of the Stugna ATGM and two D-20 cannons, already deployed at the front. They are also producing fake Patriot air defense systems and imitating Starlink systems to confuse Russian intelligence.
original:
‼Ukraine is increasing the supply of fake weapons to the front to give the Russian Federation false targets, — The Telegraph "Demand for fake weapons has increased sharply as Ukrainian troops on the front line face increased Russian strikes and reduced supplies," the newspaper writes.

The company alone built more than 200 models of the Stugna ATGM and two D-20 cannons, which are already deployed at the front. The cost of one is about a thousand hryvnias. Also, an order has already been received for the production of a model of the Patriot air defense system. It will cost approximately 10 thousand dollars. If Russia tries to hit such a pseudo-system with Iskander cruise missiles, it will cost them 3 million dollars.

Ukrainians are also imitating Starlink systems. False terminals are placed next to real ones to confuse Russian intelligence.

event: Maria Butina's Statement on Minsk's Right to Try Accused
description: Russian State Duma deputy Maria Butina stated that Belarus has the right to try those accused of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, which resulted in the deaths of Belarusian citizens in the Moscow region. She acknowledged that Belarusian authorities have begun negotiations on the matter, citing the country's legislation, including the death penalty, as justification.
original:
Butina declared the right of Minsk to try those accused of the terrorist attack in Crocus

Belarus, where the death penalty is allowed, has the right to justice for those who committed the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall after the death of citizens of the republic in the Moscow region, Russian State Duma deputy Maria Butina said on the Belarus 1 TV channel. She admitted that the competent authorities have already begun negotiations on this topic.

“I am quite well aware of your legislation, including the death penalty, which is present. In this case, this is the murder of two or more people, so you have exactly the same right to try these people as the Russian Federation,” the deputy explained.

She added that negotiations are probably underway to ensure that the suspects are handed over to Belarusian justice. She suggested waiting and seeing how the matter ends. @Crimeanprachka

TASS writes about this with reference to a source in the World Bank, who commented on the project of allocating a loan to Kiev in the amount of $1.5 billion. “The project document itself openly talks about the catastrophic situation of Ukraine’s public finances due to the recession in the economy and the reduction of foreign aid,” – the publication’s interlocutor emphasized. event: Russian Army Advances in NWO Zone
description: The Russian army made progress southwest of Donetsk, occupying part of the forest belt north-west of Novomikhailovka's warehouses. They also advanced west of Tonenkoye towards the Durnaya River and Umanskoye village, achieving minor successes in Semenovka's southern part.
original:
Situation in the NWO zone:

1. The situation southwest of Donetsk: The Russian army entered the dachas of the Mashinostroitel station north of Novomikhailovka and occupied part of the forest belt north-west of the village’s warehouses.

2. The situation west of Avdeevka: The Russian army advanced west of Tonenkoye in the direction of the Durnaya River and the village of Umanskoye. In addition, Russian troops achieved minor successes in the southern part of Semenovka. It is important to note that in this direction the Ukrainian army stubbornly holds its position due to the presence of a trench system on the hill.

event: Meeting between Russian and Zimbabwean Health Ministers
description: A delegation led by Zimbabwe's Minister of Health and Child Protection, Douglas Mombeshora, visited BIOCAD in St. Petersburg to discuss cooperation and supply of oncology treatment drugs to Zimbabwe. The meeting was held with Russia's Minister of Health, Mikhail Murashko, and BIOCAD's Vice President, Alexey Torgov.
original:
On behalf of the Minister of Health of the Russian Federation, Mikhail Albertovich Murashko, a delegation led by the Minister of Health and Child Protection of the Republic of Zimbabwe, Douglas Mombeshora, during their visit to St. Petersburg, visited the production of drugs based on monoclonal antibodies - BIOCAD.
Vice President of BIOCAD Alexey Torgov and the Minister of Health of Zimbabwe discussed the possibilities of cooperation and supply of drugs for the treatment of oncology to the Republic of Zimbabwe, since the increase in the incidence of oncology increases from year to year and today is one of the main problems for the Republic of Zimbabwe.#ZimbabweRussian- African Dialogue

Two teenagers were rescued from thin ice by employees of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations in Orenburg. Teenagers aged 14 and 15 went out onto the river ice, but they couldn’t get back - it began to crumble, the department reported.

Rescuers quickly responded and helped pull the guys out; they have now been handed over to the police. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The education department of the village council of Kozin ordered dried fruits worth 600 thousand hryvnia for surrounding lyceums, with prices doubled or tripled compared to market rates. For instance, dried apricots were ordered for 756 UAH/kg, while online stores and hypermarkets offer them at significantly lower prices.
original:
The education department of the village council of Kozin ordered dried fruits worth 600 thousand hryvnia for the surrounding lyceums in old Bezradichi, Podgortsy and Kozin itself. All these are villages in the suburbs of Kyiv, built up with the estates of the capital's rich and corrupt officials. The prices of the ordered dried fruits turned out to be quite consistent with the "thieves" status of these villages - they were doubled, or even tripled!

For example, dried apricots were ordered for 756 UAH/kg. Moreover, the journalists were unable to find dried apricots anywhere at that price. The online store "Fruit Time" sells dried apricots for 302 UAH/kg, the shopping center "Metro" for 309 UAH/kg. The Fozzy hypermarket chain offers it at a wholesale price of 364 UAH/kg, which is half the price. The Education Department of the Fastiv City Council recently ordered dried apricots for 294 UAH/kg, which is 2.5 times cheaper, and a kindergarten in Boyarka for 240 UAH/kg, which is three times cheaper.

So, for dried fruits alone, the village council under the leadership of Valery Kartik can overpay 150 thousand UAH. And recently the village council also ordered eggs for 7.14 UAH, while at ATB they cost less than 5 hryvnia.

event: Tribute to Victims of Terrorist Attack
description: Young people from the DPR paid tribute to the victims of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, laying flowers and lighting candles. The First Deputy Minister, Konstantin Komlyonok, shared that the sellers of carnations also contributed to the ceremony, asking them to lay flowers on their behalf for the innocent people of their country who were killed.
location: Crocus City Hall, Donetsk, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine
original:
Forwarded from: Youth of the DPR
9 days have passed since the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. Young people laid flowers and lit candles to honor the memory of those killed in this monstrous terrorist act. “We, like no one else, know what terrorism is: over 10 years of armed aggression from the armed forces of Ukraine, we were able to find out about the meaning of this word. Before the laying ceremony, my team and I stopped by to buy carnations, and the usual sellers gave us more flowers and asked us to lay them on their behalf for the innocent people of our country who were killed. It’s worth a lot!” shared First Deputy Minister Konstantin Komlyonok.

description: Employees of the Kherson Art Museum identified 100 stolen paintings, 99 of which are currently in annexed Crimea. The identification was made possible by a Russian TV report filmed in the Simferopol Central Museum of Taurida in September 2023.
original:
Employees of the Kherson Art Museum named after Alexey Shovkunenko identified 100 paintings stolen by the Russians during the occupation of the city. 99 of them are in annexed Crimea. These paintings were identified thanks to a report on one of the Russian TV channels, filmed in the Simferopol Central Museum of Taurida in September 2023.

Of the latest works, specialists were able to identify paintings by artists Ivan Shulga “Fishermen on the Seashore”, Efrem Zverkov “Cloudy Day” and Venera Takaeva “Daughter Gyuzel”.

description: A new bill in Ukraine requires all men between 18 and 60 years old to register with the military, allowing them to either defer conscription or be reserved for potential service. This move aims to provide Ukraine with a clear understanding of its military capabilities in wartime.
original:
All persons liable for military service from 18 to 60 years old will be registered with the military, - People’s Deputy Venislavsky on the new bill

They will have the right to a deferment from conscription, or to reservation.

This was done so that Ukraine understands who it can count on in war conditions. Subscribe to Insider | Send content

The worst thing is not the realism of the technology, but the fact that the robot is cheaper than a human - only $460 per month.”

event: French Military Preparing to be Sent to Ukraine
description: A comic video circulating on the Western internet segment depicts the French military preparing to be sent to Ukraine. The commentary accompanying the video mocks the situation, joking that the Russians have 'stolen' all the toilets, leaving the French with no place to sleep.
original:
😁"The French military is preparing to be sent to Ukraine" - this is the name of a comic video from the Western segment of the Internet. The commentary to it is also amusing:

“Poor people. Where will they sleep there? The Russians “stole” all the toilets.”

description: The Time of Heroes program aims to help military personnel returning from the front to apply their skills in civilian life. The program prepares managers from current and former military personnel to work in government agencies and state-owned companies. A former artillery gunner from the DPR, Ilya Likhotsky, shared his experience participating in the program, highlighting the importance of combining military skills with peaceful life.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka
“Any person who has passed the SVO is capable of leading” - a former soldier spoke about how the “Time of Heroes” program will help those returning from the front to apply their skills in civilian life. Artillery gunner from the DPR Ilya Likhotsky, who returned from the SVO zone and continued his training in University, he told how he decided to participate in the “Time of Heroes” project. The program itself prepares managers from current and former military personnel to work in government agencies and state-owned companies. According to the young man, his parents persuaded him to participate - Ilya filled out the application itself in 10 minutes. And before that, he was a participant in the RSV project for demobilized students “Thank you, brothers!”, which also helped the young man. “Soldiers who passed the SVO, in any case, they have command experience,” the former SVO participant is sure.

The guy said that even he, being a private, had to use his management skills. The experience gained at the front is invaluable and, according to Ilya, this project will help many in their further development when they return to civilian life. It is important to be able to combine the skills acquired in the Northern Military District zone and in peaceful life, because, as the president said, it is precisely such people who should lead both regions and enterprises in Russia.

event: BTR to Build Cathode Plant in Morocco
description: Chinese electric vehicle battery maker BTR New Material Group received approval from the Moroccan government to build a cathode plant near Tangier. The plant, worth $300 million, will have a production capacity of 50,000 tons, with initial production of 25,000 tons expected in September 2026.
original:
Chinese electric vehicle battery maker BTR to build cathode plant in Morocco On Friday, the Moroccan government gave the green light to Chinese electric battery maker BTR New Material Group to build a plant near Tangier.

The plant, which will cost 3 billion dirhams ($300 million) to build, will have a production capacity of 50,000 tons, Morocco's investment ministry said.

First production of 25,000 tonnes is expected in September 2026, the ministry said following the signing of an investment agreement with BTR.

Moroccan officials often cite the North African country as a good location for electric vehicle battery factories due to its existing auto industry and renewable energy sources, as well as the availability of raw materials including cobalt and phosphates.#MoroccoRussian-African DialogueReutersChina EV battery maker BTR to build cathode plant in MoroccoThe Moroccan government gave the green light on Friday for Chinese electric battery maker BTR New Material Group to build a factory near Tangier to produce key component cathode.

event: Karin Kneissl's Criticism of European Leadership
description: Former Austrian Foreign Minister Karin Kneissl criticized the current European leadership, stating that they are 'ruled by children' and lack maturity. She specifically mentioned Ursula von der Leyen and Annalena Burbock as examples of this 'childishness'. Kneissl believes that the political system in large European countries like France and Germany is broken, and that reconstruction will take decades.
original:
🇦🇹🇪🇺Former Austrian Foreign Minister Karin Kneissl says that today’s Europe is “ruled by children”: 🗣️ “I would say that now teenagers are running the show. They are not adults, no matter their age.

Although Mrs. Ursula von der Leyen has a more teenage approach - she does not act like an adult, mature person, thinking through all the actions to the very end and the result.

Annalena Burbock is definitely an example of such childishness. I call them teenagers because they remind me of 13-year-olds who slam the door and lock themselves in their room, shutting out the world around them. They really are like 13-year-olds, and that's a problem.

So when you want to talk to someone in Europe today, you really have a problem understanding how to choose a partner. People like Jacques Chirac, true gentlemen and ladies, are gone.

So who is your counterpart in today's Europe? And I'm afraid that reconstruction will take decades. The entire political system in large European countries like France and Germany is broken.

It was Emmanuel Macron who destroyed the political landscape. And a vacuum has formed on the political landscape.”InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBE

description: Heavy flooding in the Altai Territory has resulted in blocked roads, evacuations, and property damage. original:

In the Rodinsky and Mikhailovsky districts, 254 household plots, 10 houses were flooded, and two sections of roads were blocked. description: The Zaporizhzhya region plans to clear three rivers - Obitochnaya, Domuzly, and Maly Utlyuk - as part of its socio-economic development program. The goal is to restore the natural state of the rivers, improve water quality, and enhance recreational attractiveness.
original:
On the territory of the Zaporizhzhya region, it is planned to clear three rivers of the Azov region. Within the framework of the Program for the socio-economic development of the Zaporizhzhya region, activities are planned for 2024 to clear three rivers: Obitochnaya, with a length of 4.2 km, within Primorsk, Domuzly on the territory of the village of Priazovskoe, with a length of 8 km, and Maly Utlyuk within the borders of the town of Akimovka , length 8 km.
This decision was made during monitoring of the region’s water resources. “These are rivers that have been neglected for many years, which has led to a decrease in their inflow and water exchange.

Clearing will allow restoring the natural state of rivers, improving water quality, hydrochemical characteristics, and also restoring the recreational attractiveness of water bodies in the Zaporozhye region,” said the governor of the Zaporozhye region, Evgeniy Balitsky, on his TG channel.

He clarified that the work will be carried out jointly with the Federal Water Resources Agency.@brd_nash

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades, suppressing enemy positions. Despite enemy fire, the drones continued operating, demonstrating good results. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: Tankers of the Vostok group of troops supported the infantry offensive in the South Donetsk direction. T-80BVM tank crews approached enemy positions at close range, providing cover for assault groups on infantry fighting vehicles. The tanks fired on the move, preventing the enemy from counterattacking, and deployed smoke screens to facilitate the infantry's dismount and retreat.
original:
Tankers of the Vostok group of troops support the infantry offensive in the South Donetsk direction
Crews of T-80BVM tanks approach enemy positions at a distance of less than 100 meters, covering assault groups on infantry fighting vehicles.
Show more
“While we are driving, we shoot on the move, not allowing the enemy to stick his head out so that our infantry can get as close as possible,” says the tank commander with the call sign “Tiger.” “When the attack aircraft begin to dismount, we throw off the smoke screen and retreat.”
Such support makes assault units virtually invulnerable and minimizes losses in personnel and equipment.

description: Police in the south of the country seized ammunition and weapons intended for poaching, including 129 illegally stored 12-mm cartridges, two modified shotguns, and other equipment. Four suspects, aged 35-60, were arrested for illegal possession of weapons and ammunition.

The suspects are four men aged between 35 and 60 years old, members of a group specializing in poaching in the south of the country, suspected of illegal possession of weapons and ammunition of various types. Notebook Moldova

The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation congratulated the military personnel, thanked them for their exemplary performance of tasks and wished them further success in their military service. “I sincerely congratulate you on these high awards, high appreciation of the Motherland, and high ranks. I am sure that they will not be the last, because I am absolutely convinced that you will continue to serve our Fatherland faithfully and truly. Congratulations!" – said Army General Sergei Shoigu. According to him, the reason for the problems with the return was the agent; the sailors literally “were his hostages.” He noted that the captain had no choice but to write to all the embassies and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the country. “Many thanks to the Prosecutor General’s Office of Russia, they took us and took us away within three weeks, <...> the Russian embassy also helped us a lot,” - added the sailor.Subscribe to REN TV

description: Russia has developed its first naval kamikaze drones with artificial intelligence, dubbed 'Afalina'. The 3.5-meter surface drone can carry up to 200 kilograms of explosives or other loads, with a maximum speed of 60 km/h and a range of 500 km. It can be controlled using VR glasses, joystick, or autopilot settings. Mass production is set to begin this summer, with each unit priced at around 1 million rubles.
original:
The first naval kamikaze drones with artificial intelligence were made for the Russian army. According to Mash, mass production is planned to start this summer.

They called the 3.5-meter domestic surface Batmobile drone "Afalina". Recently, experts have been testing its draft sample on reservoirs and rivers. They say that all that remains is to improve the software and tinker with a couple of details. But we can already say that it will carry up to 200 kilograms of explosives or any other load.

In addition to this, there is a maximum speed of 60 km/h, a range of 500 km, as well as the ability to control both using VR glasses and a joystick (FPV), and using the autopilot setting. One unit of such beauty will cost only a million rubles. A possible area for use of the "Afalina" could be the Black Sea, since its functionality is wide - it can patrol, collect and conduct reconnaissance. A plus is to carry out search and evacuation activities. Subscribe to Mash

description: Boeing fired Ed Clark, the 737 MAX program manager, amid ongoing issues with the aircraft type. Clark, who also led Boeing's Renton plant, will leave the company immediately. He had led the 737 MAX program since March 2021, following the aircraft's return to service after two crashes.
original:
Forwarded from: FlightMode
Boeing fired 737 MAX program manager Boeing fired Ed Clark, 737 MAX program manager. The decision highlights ongoing problems with the type of aircraft and the company's intention to show that it is taking it seriously.

Ed Clark, who also ran Boeing's Renton, Wash., plant, will leave the company effective immediately, according to an internal memo.

Clark gave Boeing 18 years. He has led the 737 MAX program since March 2021, immediately after the type returned to service after two crashes. Previously, he held various positions related to the 737 MAX, such as chief engineer and chief mechanic.

In addition to the problems that led to the grounding of the 737 MAX 8 and MAX 9 after a number of incidents, problems at Boeing also delayed the certification of two new versions of the aircraft - the MAX 7 and the longer version, the MAX 10.FlightMode

event: Discovery of Jehovah's Witnesses Extremist Materials
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol identified a location used by the banned Jehovah's Witnesses organization to promote extremist ideology. Over 5,000 books were confiscated, with half intended for distribution among school-age children. The literature contained propaganda promoting exclusivity and superiority based on social, racial, national, or religious affiliation. Financial reports revealed the organization's involvement in financing Ukrainian armed forces.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

The ideological content of the seized literature included elements of propaganda of the exclusivity and superiority of a person based on his social, racial, national, religious affiliation or attitude to religion.

Despite the expressed anti-war rhetoric of the organization’s doctrinal documents, during the analysis of the discovered financial reports, information was obtained about its involvement in the financing of Ukrainian armed forces.@PushilinDenis

event: Raw Materials Giants Need Crisis in Ukraine
description: Large raw materials and commodity companies, such as Glencore, have reported record profits during the Ukrainian crisis. As the economic environment stabilizes, profits have dropped, and companies are reducing dividends to shareholders. Experts believe that a new round of military operations in Ukraine is needed to maintain high profits.
original:
​Raw materials giants need a crisis in Ukraine🇷🇺💰🇺🇦It may seem strange, but large raw materials and commodity companies received their record profits during the Ukrainian crisis. Many of them have now even decided to take an unpopular step - they have reduced dividends to their shareholders. Reuters reports this.

For example, Glencore reports a sharp drop in profits as the economic environment stabilizes. The recession-prone, sluggish macroeconomy, without jumps, does not generate windfall profits, unlike the peaks of indicators during crises.

It is no secret that peaceful life is not always beneficial for business, whose record performance usually lies in the area of ​​hype or market overheating.

The efforts of Saudi Arabia and the attacks of the Houthis are not enough; for this, a more serious irritant is needed, which the North Military District in Ukraine has become.

The worst thing is that the peak of the macroeconomic cooling has not yet been reached; it is planned for the end of 2024. Therefore, for large profits, the raw materials and commodity giants need a new round of military operations in Ukraine.

According to independent experts, in fact, nothing terrible happened. It’s just that the markets have returned to reality, and the giants’ profits are already very good, higher than the average in previous years before the crisis.

The decline was recorded only in relation to the huge revenues of 2022-2023.

Now it will be difficult for company management to get used to slow, routine and painstaking work in the same rhythm to maintain their market share. The taste for easy money has still not faded, even if only due to social upheaval and conflict. But conscience quickly disappears when tens of billions of dollars of net profit are at stake.

description: Police seized 50 grams of cannabis from a 53-year-old Gorlovka resident, who had picked and processed the drug for personal use. The individual faces up to three years of imprisonment.
original:
👮‍♂️Police seized drugs from a Gorlovka resident

Employees of the investigation department of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs "Gorlovskoye" brought a 53-year-old man to criminal responsibility for possession of cannabis. The attacker faces imprisonment for up to three years.❗️During the investigation, law enforcement officers established that last summer the defendant picked parts of a hemp plant on the territory of his household, which he dried, crushed and stored at his place of residence for personal use without the purpose of sale. The total weight of the seized drugs was about 50 grams.

Based on this fact, a criminal case was initiated under Part 1 of Art. 228 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (illegal acquisition, storage, transportation without the purpose of selling narcotic drugs, psychotropic substances or their analogues in a significant amount). The sanction of the article provides for a maximum penalty of imprisonment for a term of up to 3 years.

Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
for the Donetsk People's Republic

A Renault policeman from Podolsk collided with a Volkswagen and, after a powerful blow, flew into a snowdrift. At that moment, there were two women in the official car, one of whom was pinned inside, and a 14-year-old teenager. A girl was also driving the second car. As a result, two women were hospitalized in Sklif with traumatic brain injuries, one was taken with a broken hip to the Botkin hospital, and a teenager was taken to the children's hospital on Bolshaya Polyanka with a severe bruise to the chest and head.

event: EU Cuts Science Funding to Support Ukraine
description: The European Council has cut the Horizon Europe budget by 2.1 billion euros to allocate funds towards supporting Ukraine's recovery, reconstruction, and modernization efforts. The decision is part of a revised Multiannual Financial Program (MFF) for 2021-2027, with an emphasis on stable financial support for Ukraine from 2024-2027.
original:
Europe cuts science funding by 2.1 billion euros to help Ukraine The decision to cut the Horizon Europe budget by 2.1 billion euros was made by the European Council.

The decision to allocate €2.1 billion, of which €1.5 billion to support defense research, to the Horizon Europe budget, was taken by the European Council (EU heads of state) at the beginning of the month. An agreement was reached to revise the Multiannual Financial Program (MFF) for 2021-2027 with an emphasis on stable financial support for Ukraine for the period 2024-2027.

A Ukraine Fund will be created with total resources not exceeding €50 billion, including loans and grant support, to assist Ukraine's recovery, reconstruction and modernization efforts. The Council stressed the importance of Ukraine's support for democratic mechanisms and human rights as a precondition for support.

In addition, the document examines migration problems, strategic technologies, interest payments, new own resources, solidarity assistance reserves and measures to mitigate the impact on national budgets.

description: An international security operation, Operation Cronos, was initiated by the British NCA against the LockBit extortion gang. The operation involved 11 countries and resulted in the seizure of 34 LockBit servers, obtaining important information on operators, arresting over 200 cryptocurrency accounts, detaining two members in Poland and Ukraine, and seizing over 1000 encryption keys.
original:
Forwarded from: SecAtor
͏The details of the international security operation Operation Cronos initiated by the British NCA a few months ago against the LockBit extortion gang have been revealed. As previously reported, through the coordinated efforts of the intelligence services of 11 countries, security forces managed to seize part of the northern infrastructure of LockBit, penetrate the admin area of the partner network and get to the source code.

Now, according to official press releases, during the operation there were:
- 34 LockBit servers were captured, - important information on LockBit operators was obtained, - more than 200 cryptocurrency accounts with proceeds from ransoms were arrested,
- two members of the organization were detained in Poland and Ukraine, - a reward was awarded for information about the identity of LockbitSupp,
- more than 1000 encryption keys were seized.

In addition to having fun in chats with operators who were asked to issue LockbitSupp, the security forces also had fun with the DLS website, where instead of victims they posted links with the results of Operation Cronos. In addition, officials also published screenshots of various parts of the LockBit server as proof of the stated results.

The resulting encryption keys were transferred to the Japanese National Police, which developed a utility for decrypting files on Windows systems. The utility is available as part of the No More Ransom project. Another noteworthy detail: the mentioned LockbitSupp vulnerability CVE-2023-3824 in PHP, used to hack the gang’s servers, according to researchers, was unlikely to be the key one the cause of a total fiasco, although exploitation is theoretically possible. Of course, Operation Cronos is a blow to the very heart of LockBitransomware, but apparently not fatal.

The consequences will primarily affect the operators, whose ranks will soon begin to thin out, becoming future targets of the intelligence services.

The appearance of such children's centers in warehouses became possible thanks to the "Childhood to be!" project, which we implement together with the "Women's Unity" foundation.

And today they concluded a memorandum of cooperation with the organization in order to continue implementing useful initiatives.

event: US Supplying F-35A Fighters to Greece
description: The US will supply Greece with F-35A fighters under certain conditions, despite the Lausanne and Paris treaties restricting Greek aircraft from flying over demilitarized islands, rendering them practically useless in key areas.
original:
🇬🇷🇺🇸The US is already openly mocking Greece

The United States will supply Greece with F-35A fighters under certain conditions. According to the Lausanne and Paris treaties, Greek aircraft cannot even fly over the demilitarized islands. That is, they are, in fact, practically useless in the most necessary areas.

Let me remind you that the saga with the F-35 has been going on for more than a year. Initially, Türkiye was supposed to receive these aircraft. Despite the fact that Ankara paid for them, Greece will receive the planes, and the Turks, at best, will get F-16s.

As a result, Turkey is developing its fifth-generation aircraft, and Greece is doing almost everything that the United States says, being, in fact, an American base. description: Lyudmila Navalnaya, Alexei Navalny's mother, reported threats from authorities to 'do something with the body' if she refused a secret funeral. She was taken to the morgue, shown her son's body, and given conditions for the burial, which she deemed illegal.
original:
“Looking into my eyes, they say that if I don’t agree to a secret funeral, they will do something with my son’s body.”

Alexei Navalny's mother said that they want to bury him secretly. And she reported threats to “do something with the body.” In a new video, Lyudmila Navalnaya says that she just left the building of the Salekhard Investigative Committee, where she spent almost a day. According to her, last night security forces secretly took the woman to the morgue, where they showed the politician’s body. Navalny’s mother says that at the moment all medical and legal documents are ready, but the body is not being given to her, setting the conditions “where, when and how Alexey should be buried.” “This is illegal, in my presence they receive orders - either from the Kremlin, or from the central office of the Investigative Committee. They want this to be done secretly without saying goodbye, they want to take me to the outskirts of the cemetery to a fresh grave and say “here lies your son,” the woman said.

She does not agree with these conditions. According to her, they threaten her, promising to “do something with the body” if she refuses. Lyudmila Navalnaya said that the investigator told her that “time is not on your side, the corpse is decomposing.” The politician's mother again demanded that his body be immediately returned to his family.

description: The third 'Defenders of the Fatherland Cup' tournament is taking place in the Kaluga region from February 21 to 24, featuring over 200 veterans of the Northern Military District from the Central and Northwestern Federal Districts. The event aims to promote the involvement of special operations veterans in sports, with a focus on rehabilitation and physical and moral well-being.
original:
Forwarded from: Defenders of the Fatherland
Northern Military District veterans from 29 regions of the country are taking part in the third “Defenders of the Fatherland Cup” The tournament takes place in the Kaluga region from February 21 to 24. More than 200 veterans of the Northern Military District from the Central and Northwestern Federal Districts are participating in it. The official start of the competition took place at the Central Sports Palace in Kaluga.🔸The event was opened by the Chairman of the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation Anna Tsivileva, Deputy of the State Duma of the Russian Federation Alexander Karelin, Governor of the Kaluga Region Vladislav Shapsha, President of the Russian Paralympic Committee Pavel Rozhkov.🔸“Sport is the best rehabilitation for heroes. Workloads, communication with like-minded people and, of course, victories have a positive effect on the physical and moral state of defenders. That is why the foundation pays great attention to projects that promote the involvement of special operations veterans in sports. And we see huge returns! If at first we planned to hold the Cup once a year, now we hold it once every three to four months. About 500 demobilized soldiers have already taken part in the “Defenders of the Fatherland Cup,” said Anna Tsivileva, chairman of the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation. The first Cup was held in Kuzbass in August 2023, the second in the Republic of Bashkortostan. In 2024, three interregional tournaments will take place, and in December - the All-Russian “Defenders of the Fatherland Cup.” 🔸 “If in the first “Defenders of the Fatherland Cup” the participants got acquainted with the disciplines and gained experience, now these are trained special operation veterans who have set a goal for themselves and want to play sports professionally. In the future, we expect many of them to join Russia’s national Paralympic sports teams, because today they are already participating in all-Russian competitions as members of the country’s national teams,” noted the President of the Russian Paralympic Committee, Pavel Rozhkov.🔸For two days, veterans of the Northern Military District will compete in bullet shooting, arm wrestling, archery, powerlifting, table tennis and sitting volleyball.

They are making amulets, cards, and camouflage nets for military personnel. Additionally, the Women's Council and the Path of Faith charity foundation are creating food packages for wounded servicemen in the hospital.
original:
Preparations for Defender of the Fatherland Day are in full swing

On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, volunteers of the Gorlovka women's movement are actively preparing for the holiday. Women make amulets and cards with their own hands for our military personnel, and also continue to weave camouflage nets.

Volunteers are also helped in this important matter by members of the military-patriotic clubs “CORSA” and “Amazon”.

The Chairman of the Women's Council of the city of Gorlovka, Adiya Kudryakova, together with her ally, the head of the Path of Faith charity foundation, Vera Kalmykova, purchased everything they needed and created food packages for visiting wounded servicemen in the hospital.

event: Attack on Military Airfield in Mirgorod
description: Attack drones 'Geran-2' struck the military airfield in Mirgorod, causing a fire and secondary detonation in the southwestern part of the object. The attack resulted in the destruction of one Su-24M bomber and one MiG-29 fighter, both equipped with advanced missiles. The strike was carried out during the preparation of aircraft for combat sorties, potentially neutralizing a threat to Russian territory.
original:
🇷🇺🇺🇦Analysis of the results of the defeat of the military airfield in MirgorodTonight, with the use of attack drones "Geran-2", strikes were carried out on the territory of the military airfield "Mirgorod".Coordinates: 49.9310834, 33.6431029🔻In accordance with the information provided, two defeats were confirmed in the southwestern part of the object - a fire occurred on the spot, which was accompanied by secondary detonation.🔻At the moment, reliable data have been received about the defeat of one Su-24M bomber (possibly with installed ADM-160 MALD missiles) and one MiG-29 fighter on board which were installed SCALP missiles (probably a secondary detonation was provoked by the defeat exactly these ammunition).

The exact extent of damage to the aircraft and the possibility of their further operation/restoration are unknown. It is important to note that the strikes were carried out during the preparation of aircraft for combat sorties, which was carried out by the enemy as part of planning attacks on Russian territory in the near future (there is a high activity of NATO AWACS aircraft in The Black Sea region and the European border area).📌I do not rule out the fact that the purpose of this strike was to neutralize the potential existing threat and weaken the enemy even before he could fully organize his forces.

"Partian!"

event: Russian Ambassador's Response to Biden's Comments

Antonov expressed doubt about receiving an adequate response, citing the upcoming November elections in America. He also criticized the current administration's approach, comparing it unfavorably to past leaders like J. Kennedy, who advocated for respectful dialogue with Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Embassy of Russia in the USA / Russian Embassy in the USA
Answer of the Russian Ambassador to the USA A.I. Antonov to a media question❓: Dear Anatoly Ivanovich, what is the reaction of the Russian Embassy in Washington to Biden’s offensive attack on V.V. Putin? A.I. Antonov: As soon as I started work this morning State Department, we sent a strong note of protest about the outrageous nature and inadmissibility of insults by the American leadership against the Russian President.❌ It is unlikely that the current situation can be resolved with a simple apology, and the American authorities will not agree to this. Strictly speaking, we do not count on an adequate response .As we approach the November elections in America, this kind of escapades are becoming routine.👉I will add: The United States is rich in a galaxy of talented and wise politicians who have done a lot to transform the country into a powerful and once respected power. However, in today's Washington, the behests of their ancestors have practically been forgotten. It is enough to mention J. Kennedy, who at the height of the Cold War spoke about the importance of respectful attitude towards Russia, avoiding derogatory statements. On the contrary, the tabloid showdowns and obscene language that were common in the wild West have become commonplace here.☝️The administration continues to destroy the remnants of the positive legacy of Russian-American relations. Everything is being done to provoke us to take emotional retaliatory steps. It is obvious that rudeness, swearing, and obscene statements do not serve to strengthen strategic security, which is so necessary for the world in the current historical conditions. We are confident that the unacceptable rhetoric of the American authorities only testifies to the impotence and lack of common sense in the current policy towards Russia.

event: Establishment of Real Estate Financing Coordination Mechanism
description: China has established a real estate financing coordination mechanism in 214 cities across 29 provinces to promote sustainable development of the real estate market. The Ministry of Housing, Urban and Rural Construction has published a whitelist of 5,349 eligible projects, with 162 projects in 57 cities receiving bank financing totaling 4.14 billion USD.
original:
Forwarded from: Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the Russian Federation
A mechanism to coordinate real estate financing has been established in 214 cities in China.

BEIJING, Feb. 21 (Xinhua) -- As of Feb. 20, 2024, a total of 214 cities in 29 provinces in China have established real estate financing coordination mechanisms, part of the country's efforts to promote sustainable development of the real estate market.
 
China's Ministry of Housing, Urban and Rural Construction said on Tuesday it had published whitelist packages of 5,349 real estate projects eligible for financial support and sent them to commercial banks.
 
According to the aforementioned ministry, to date, about 162 projects in 57 cities have received bank financing totaling 29.43 billion yuan (about 4.14 billion U.S. dollars).
 
Local governments and financial institutions are actively implementing such coordination mechanisms, and according to the Bank of China, China Construction Bank, Agricultural Bank of China, Postal Savings Bank of China and some joint-stock banks, loans amounting to 123 have been approved for listed projects .6 billion yuan.
 
China in January this year announced a plan to establish a financing coordination mechanism for the real estate sector to meet legitimate project financing needs of the sector and support the stable and healthy growth of the country's real estate market.

description: A survey by 'Psychodemiya' revealed that over 43% of psychologists in Russia have a negative attitude towards the draft law on psychological assistance, fearing it could harm their practice. Another 38.2% do not expect any deterioration but disagree with the main provisions. The respondents are primarily concerned about disclosing confidential information without a court decision and the requirement for mandatory higher psychological education.
original:
More than 43% of psychologists have a negative attitude towards the draft law on psychological assistance in Russia, which is being prepared for submission to the State Duma, believing that innovations could harm their practice. Another 38.2% do not expect any deterioration, but still do not agree with the main provisions of the document. This became known from a survey of practicing psychologists conducted by the online school of psychological professions “Psychodemiya”.

The respondents are most concerned about two points: 90% do not want to disclose confidential information at the request of the bodies of inquiry and investigation without a court decision, 57.2% are against the requirement for mandatory higher psychological education.@kommersant

event: Google Apologizes for AI Image Generation Inaccuracies
description: Google has formally apologized for inaccuracies in its AI image generation technology, Gemini, which generated people with non-white skin tones in photographs where they should be white. The company aims to improve the algorithm to respect ethnic diversity without compromising historical accuracy.
original:
Neural networks that generate images are often criticized for their stereotypical solutions. The new product from Google has the opposite: the Vikings and Nazis turn out to be dark-skinned. The company apologized and promised to improve the algorithm Google has formally apologized for “inaccuracies” in the generation of images of people using artificial intelligence technology Gemini, after users noticed that it was generating people with non-white skin tones in photographs, where, given the context, they should be white.

In response to requests to generate images of blacks, Asians or Hispanics in any combination, Gemini drew suitable pictures, but the neural network refused to fulfill the request to generate two white cyclists, explaining this by the need to respect ethnic diversity.

Users have also complained en masse about Gemini's depictions of historical figures, noting that the company's efforts to be inclusive make them historically inaccurate. Thus, the neural network generated images of dark-skinned Vikings, 19th-century American senators, popes or soldiers of Nazi Germany.

Read what else is known about this story on the Meduza website.

———Open material VPN.Meduza Neural networks that generate images are often criticized for their stereotypical solutions. Google has issued an official apology for “inaccuracies” in the generation of images of people using artificial intelligence technology Gem...

event: Factory Tests of Electric Motors for Drones
description: Specialists from the Ulan-Ude Instrument-Making Production Association (U-UPPO) successfully completed factory tests of new electric motors for aircraft drones. The motors, manufactured entirely from domestic components, have less weight and higher efficiency compared to foreign analogues.
original:
New KRET electric motors for drones have passed factory tests. Specialists from the Ulan-Ude Instrument-Making Production Association (U-UPPO) of the Radio-Electronic Technologies Concern have successfully completed factory tests of the latest electric motors for aircraft drones. During a working visit to Buryatia, the Plenipotentiary Representative of the President of the Russian Federation in the Far Eastern Federal District, Yuri Trutnev, got acquainted with the promising development.

The plenipotentiary was shown a new line of engines for unmanned aircraft systems, as well as electric precipitators. Yuri Trutnev set the task of continuing and strengthening work in this direction."The first pilot batch of modern electric motors has already passed factory tests, as well as tests as installed samples for the Burya-10 aircraft-type unmanned aerial vehicle. The products are manufactured entirely from domestic components and, "Unlike foreign analogues, they have less weight and higher efficiency. The enterprise is ready to supply the entire line of products for production. For this, we have the necessary personnel potential and machine park," noted Vladimir Luchnikov, General Director of U-UPPO.

Today, the Ulan-Ude Instrument-Making Production Association is the only enterprise in Siberia and the Far East that develops a modern line of brushless, stepper electric motors and generators. Similar types of engines are used in the production of aircraft drones, in industry and mechanical engineering.

At the moment, the enterprise has developed and is mastering the production of four types of electric motors, which were named after the Baikal winds: “Sarma”, “Khius”, “Barguzin”, “Kultuk”. Each differs in a number of parameters, including power.@wingsofwar

description: Captured soldier Roman Zhernov was subjected to torture by his captors, who demanded indecent photographs from his wife in exchange for ceasing the torture. The captors threatened to cut off Zhernov's fingers if the wife refused and forced him to call her to ask her to comply with their demands.
original:
What kind of bastards are we really fighting with? The story we told about earlier is repeated.
Reportedly, on February 5, some freaks got in touch with the wife of another soldier, Roman Zhernov, who was captured, and demanded from her photographs of an indecent nature, promising to stop torture in exchange; if the woman refused, they began to threaten to cut off the soldier’s fingers; to make matters worse, they forced the prisoner to call his wife and ask her to talk to the torturers, since he is being severely beaten.
Since February 5 there has been no news of the prisoner.

Apparently these are the same freaks as last time, it’s good to be such a “hero” if it costs nothing, but every person has something to lose, every person, even if he is a sadistic little Russian, has something that he loves.

How many people do you think, in theory, would there be left who would want to do this if they demonstratively went through everything dear to this sadist with fire and sword a couple of times? If suddenly with those whom he loves... We think so, out loud, and the point here is not bloodthirstiness, the point is that the Middle Ages must be educated using the same methods.

Dear women, our rear, we certainly have no right to advise you on anything, but God forbid, it would be more correct to act as these women did, because someone who saw the face of a war criminal torturing a person will still not be left alive, but in If their conditions are met, they will not only kill you, but also thoroughly humiliate you.
Our humble subjective opinion. NgP exploration

event: Criminal Case Initiated for Cannabis Possession
description: A 53-year-old resident of Gorlovka faces up to 3 years imprisonment for possessing 50 grams of cannabis. The individual was found to have picked, dried, and stored the drug for personal use without intent to sell.
original:
For possession of 50 grams of cannabis, a resident of Gorlovka faces imprisonment for up to 3 years

Employees of the investigation department of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs "Gorlovskoye" brought a 53-year-old man to criminal responsibility for possession of cannabis. This was reported by the press service of the DPR Ministry of Internal Affairs.

During the investigation, law enforcement officers established that last summer the defendant picked parts of a hemp plant on the territory of his household, which he dried, crushed and stored at his place of residence for personal use without the purpose of sale.

The total weight of the seized drugs was about 50 grams.

Based on this fact, a criminal case was initiated under Part 1 of Art. 228 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (illegal acquisition, storage, transportation without the purpose of selling narcotic drugs, psychotropic substances or their analogues in a significant amount).

The sanction of the article provides for a maximum penalty of imprisonment for a term of up to 3 years. @gorlovka- "Gorlovka. Today". #gorlovka

event: Possible Visit of Japanese Prime Minister to Pyongyang
description: Kim Yo Jong, sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, hinted at the possibility of Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida visiting Pyongyang if Tokyo ceases its hostile policy towards the DPRK. This unusual statement may be aimed at undermining the tough stance of South Korea's president, Yun Seok Yeol, ahead of parliamentary elections, or driving a wedge into the cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan.
location: Pyongyang, Pyongyang Capital City, North Korea
original:
🇰🇵🇯🇵In East Asia, meanwhile, they started talking about the possible visit of Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishidy to Pyongyang. The reason for such unusual discussions was the sister of the North Korean leader, Kim Yo Jong, who is far from the last figure in the DPRK.

Last week, she said that interaction with Japan would be possible if Tokyo ceases to pursue a hostile policy towards the DPRK. Her comments were in response to Kishida's recent speech. In it, he stated the need to resolve the problem of kidnapped Japanese citizens who were forcibly transported to the DPRK back in the 20th century.

Previously, such statements had not been made by North Korean politicians. Therefore, comments about even possible interaction seem strange.

However, it may be simpler than it seems. Parliamentary elections will soon be held in the Republic of Korea. The current president, Yun Seok Yeol, and his party are pursuing a tough policy towards the DPRK. Kim Yo Jong's comments may be designed to undermine the "correctness" of this course in the eyes of South Koreans, who will vote for less hostile liberals.

By the way, the question of the return of kidnapped Japanese citizens by Kishida is most often raised when the rating of his government becomes extremely low. The recent call for a solution to the issue also fell during this period, with the level of support falling to a record low. Given this, another purpose of Kim Yo Jong's statements may be visible - to drive a wedge into the deepening cooperation of South Korea, the United States and Japan. That is, to raise his rating, the Japanese prime minister should not interact so actively with Seoul and Washington.

Here it’s a matter of choice - either to reduce cooperation, which is a priori impossible now, or to look for another way to increase the level of trust, otherwise you may not remain in power.

Of course, the likelihood of resolving the issue and starting some kind of dialogue remains extremely low. The problem of kidnapped Japanese in the North itself is considered to have been resolved long ago. Recent comments, although they still pursue vaguely clear goals, are more reminiscent of flirting with the Japanese domestic agenda - it’s not for nothing that Kim Yo Jong sits in the agitation and propaganda department. @awaken_dragonTACC Kim Jong-un’s sister allowed the possibility of a visit by the Japanese Prime Minister to PyongyangEvents in Russia and the world. Analytical publications. Materials of press conferences. Video and photo reports

Why Petliura lost I recently saw a Ukrainian historical story about the reasons for the defeat of the Ukrainian People's Republic in 1919. To put it simply, why didn’t Petlyura succeed?

description: Russian troops defeated the Swedes in the Battle of Krasny Kut, nearly capturing King Charles XII. The battle led to Sweden's decline as a major power and the loss of territories to Russia.
original:
On February 22, 1709, during the Northern War (1700-1721), Russian troops defeated the Swedes in the Battle of Krasny Kut, almost capturing King Charles XII.

Immediately after the Battle of Krasny Kut, on February 22, 1709, when King Charles XII of Sweden almost died or was captured, he for the first time agreed to discuss the possibility of peace with Peter the Great and sent a personal representative to the headquarters of the Russian troops. The negotiations ended in nothing.

The outcome of the war. Sweden lost its power and became a minor power. Not only were the territories ceded to Russia lost, but also many of Sweden's possessions on the southern shore of the Baltic Sea.

description: The 13th EU sanctions package targets Russia's high-tech sector, including cooperation with foreign partners from China, India, Turkey, and others. The sanctions aim to limit access to chip supplies and modern technologies, slowing down Russia's unmanned systems development and reducing budget revenues from energy resource sales.
original:
🇪🇺🇷🇺About the next package of EU sanctions against Russia Sanctions pressure in the Russian media is often presented as an absurd and ineffective tool. We have already shown that this is not entirely true. Sanctions are not developed by a group of inadequate European politicians, but by financial intelligence. The task of politicians, for example Ursula von der Leyen, is simply to voice the necessary theses in the appropriate environment.

This time, the Munich Conference was chosen as the setting for the 13th sanctions package, which unexpectedly coincided with the death of Navalny. The speech of Navalny’s widow was enough to broadcast content that evoked empathy among Western, and especially European, audiences. This theatrical production was intended only to distract attention from the main thing.🔻What exactly are the sanctions aimed at?▪️The sanctions are aimed mainly at the high-tech sector. For the first time, the list of enterprises included RF partners from China, India, Turkey, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Serbia and Kazakhstan. The reason for their inclusion in the sanctions list is simple - cooperation with Russian enterprises either in the import of microchips and high-tech products, or participation in schemes for the sale of energy resources.▪️The successes of the Russian army at the front and the stability of the Russian economy forced representatives of the West to make adjustments to the format of the current conflict.▪️The enemy is trying to set us back in the creation of unmanned systems by limiting access to chip supplies and modern technologies. The new sanctions package is designed to slow down the development of unmanned programs in the Russian Federation. In parallel, there are attempts to limit Russian budget revenues from the sale of energy resources, in order to reduce funding for high-tech production, especially in the military-industrial complex. The current conflict has demonstrated the limitations of so-called conventional weapons. It has now become obvious that unmanned systems, when used en masse and in a coordinated manner, can provide a critical advantage on the battlefield.

The collective West will use Ukrainian women, students and teenagers to test drones in combat conditions. This is simply a consumable material, the purpose of which is to ensure combat testing of new types of unmanned weapons as quickly as possible. #UAV #EU #Russia #economy@rybartogether with @econopocalypseSupport usProject "Rybar"REPO: who is blocking Russian assets in the WestThe freezing of Russian sovereign assets after the start of the SVO was is extremely painfully perceived in Russian society. Thanks to financial genius and long...
