description: Major Vitaly Primak, a former special forces operative from Russia, testified to Ukrainian and ICC prosecutors about the systematic torture and inhumane methods used by Putin's special services against captured Ukrainians. His testimony, supported by documents and materials, exposes the crimes of the Russian regime.
original:
The ZDF TV channel presented another part of the documentary film “Putin’s Warriors”, which tells and shows the story of internal service major Vitaly Primak from the special forces detachment “Typhoon” of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia in St. Petersburg and the Leningrad region, who left Russia and with the support of the human rights team Gulagu net testified to prosecutors of the Office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine and ICC investigators about the systematic torture and cruel inhumane methods that Putin’s special services apply to captured Ukrainians, forcing them to “cooperate” and sign self-incriminations, on the basis of which pseudo-courts pronounce verdicts of genocide and falsify materials for justifications for war and aggression against Ukraine.

This is the first interview with Major Vitaly Primak and an exclusive for the ZDF channel and the StoryHouse film crew. Over the past more than 1.5 years, employees and officers of the special services have been evacuated from Russia, who have already been interrogated and included in witness protection programs, and their testimony is confirmed by documents, materials, photo and video archives, which were collected by experts and coordinators of Gulagu net and the Atlantic Detective team .

This series of documentaries clearly shows how much work you and I have done over the years to help international investigations and justice. This is a unique experience and it is important for us to continue to work hard and expose the crimes of the bloody regime.

Please continue to support us with subscriptions, sponsorships, likes and reposts. We risk ourselves and waste our lives and nerves, and do what films are already being made and books are being written about. Help us remain powerful, fast and efficient, independent and effective✊🏻https://www.zdf.de/dokumentation/putins-krieger/putins-krieger-104.htmlwww.zdf.de4/4 Witalij: Ein russischer Elite-Kämpfer packt ausDer Elitesoldat Witalij zählte einst zu Putins loyalen Kriegern. Der Ukrainekrieg raubte ihm die Illusion. Er berichtet über Russands Kriegsmaschine.

🇷🇺Medvedev called Odessa a Russian city, which the Russian Federation has been waiting for, and called on Odessa to return home.

“About Odessa, I can simply say: Odessa, come home. And that’s all. We have been waiting for Odessa in the Russian Federation, even because of the history of this city, what kind of people live there, what language they speak. This is our Russian, Russian city,” - he said. Subscribe to the channel

event: Police Hand Out Warnings to Navalny Supporters
description: In Kurgan, police are issuing warnings to individuals who laid flowers in memory of Navalny, threatening them with liability under the article on illegal picketing if they participate in mass actions. The police are going door-to-door, asking for personal information and attempting to deliver the warnings.
original:
In Kurgan, police are handing out “warnings” to people who laid flowers in memory of Navalny. Last weekend, Kurgan residents who tried to lay flowers in memory of the politician were allowed to the spontaneous memorial only after their passport details were copied. Today, police officers came to those who left the data with a warning against participating in some kind of mass action. In the document, the police warn that if they participate in it, they may be held liable under the article on illegal picketing.

“We called my mother and found out if she knew me, where I lived, and my phone number. She passed on their phone number to me and I contacted her. Judging by the number, this is a local police officer, and not from my area. He said that there is a paper, it needs to be signed, he is ready to drive up at any time and in any place. I refused, after which they came to my grandmother’s apartment to hand over a warning addressed to my mother. Mom hasn’t lived there for a long time, they started asking for her number. Despite the fact that before that they called her to find out information about me,” a local resident told “Beware the News.” It is known that two Kurgan residents were able to hand over such a document; two more received calls from the police, but they refused the paper.

event: Congress of the Union of Donbass Volunteers
description: The Union of Donbass Volunteers gathered for their congress, where they will discuss the past year's results and set future tasks within the framework of the SVO. The event is attended by prominent figures, including the head of the SDD and the founder of Tsargrad TV. Military correspondent Algis Mikulskis is covering the event, highlighting the bravery and camaraderie of the Russian volunteers.
original:
“Here they are all! Russians": Heroes of the Northern Military District gathered for the congress of the Union of Donbass Volunteers
Today the next congress of the Union of Donbass Volunteers begins its work. There the results of the year that have passed since the previous congress, which took place in Mariupol, will be summed up, and also determined
Show more
further tasks of the organization within the framework of the SVO.
The film crew of “The First Russian” and its military correspondent Algis Mikulskis will cover what is happening and promptly broadcast the most significant news about the meeting of Russian volunteers.
It is expected that the event will be attended by the head of the SDD, State Duma deputy, commander of the St. Georgy" Alexander Borodai and the founder of Tsargrad TV Konstantin Malofeev.
In the meantime, “a miracle of recognition is happening.” Battle brothers in chain mail of military awards, wounded, limping, but smiling, gathered for the congress. Their!
Military correspondent of Constantinople Algis Mikulskis reports:
“Here is the commander of the 1st company of the RShO “Bastion” Zeleny. In a dashingly twisted black Marine beret. Tells you:
"Brother!!! Come on, take pictures!!!"
And you are happy to take pictures with this dashing guy, who endured five days of encirclement in the company of three more equally dashing guys.
And here is Arab, looking like an action hero in his exoskeleton.
And here is Biryuk from BARS-23. The same one who could not read a child’s letter to a “SVO fighter” without tears, then went and calmly neutralized a Ukrainian “hurricane” that did not work near the PVD.
Here is Lyosha Viking, commander of the same BARS-23. Sedate, dressed in civilian clothes.
Here is Odin, the chief medical officer of “Bastion,” a hefty “bespectacled” doctor who has rescued more than a dozen guys from the other world.
Here is Zen, the older brother of Sanya Melnikov, the author of songs about what is happening...
Here is Mustang, here is Vidocq, here is Agape, here is the Bard, here is the Doctor... Here they are all! Russians. My brothers.
And here next to them is my reinforced concrete confidence that we will win.”

description: The FSB revealed that the British Council, a UK government organization, was involved in intelligence gathering in the Kherson region through controlled organizations. Under the guise of promoting education and culture, the council used Ukrainian refugees in the UK to obtain military-political information from their connections in Kherson.
original:
02.22.24. Relevant.
“The FSB reported that the British government organization “British Council” was engaged in intelligence in the Kherson region through controlled organizations.
Show more
The officially stated goals of the council are to develop cooperation in education and culture, but in reality all this is just a cover for the work of the intelligence services, the FSB says.
Thus, the British Council used Ukrainian refugees living in Great Britain to obtain “information of a military-political nature” through their connections in the Kherson region.
Russian citizen Sergei Chebukin came under the influence of the organization, who eventually realized that he was being drawn into criminal schemes and turned to law enforcement.
An acquaintance associated with the British Council and who had left Ukraine for Britain suggested that he pass on the coordinates of the locations of Russian military personnel and equipment.
She told him that it is difficult for Ukrainian refugees to stay in Britain - only those who can be useful to the authorities are not expelled. For this reason, she agreed to carry out intelligence gathering missions.”

event: Shelling of Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant
description: Enemy shelling at the Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant resulted in the shutdown of one of the two power lines. The remaining overhead line is the only connection to Ukraine's energy system, and its damage could lead to a complete blackout and potentially a nuclear and radiation accident.
location: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, Enerhodar, Zaporizhzhia Oblast, Ukraine
original:
☢️At the Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant, one of the two power lines was switched off due to enemy shelling. According to the head of the Zaporozhye OVA, Ivan Fedorov, now only one overhead line connects the station to the energy system of Ukraine. “If it is damaged, we will get another complete blackout - the ninth. And in the event of failure of emergency diesel generators and safety systems, we have the threat of a nuclear and radiation accident,” he noted.

Fedorov added that an additional danger is created by the expiring expiration date of nuclear fuel and the mines that the Russians have installed along the perimeter of the Zaporizhia NPP. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: The 60th Munich Security Conference brought together over 90 ministers from 40 countries, marking a resurgence of Western forums since the start of the SVO. European leaders discussed creating their own independent military and technological infrastructure, potentially leading to a European army.
original:
The 60th anniversary Munich Security Conference, which took place last weekend, brought together more than 90 ministers from 40 countries.

It has been carried out since 1963 and has long become a routine: materials from 30–40 years ago reflect the mood of the period of reduction of armaments and armies in Europe (but not in the USA).

After the start of the SVO, all such Western forums experienced a renaissance. But the world press has never written about a single conference so often and so much before. One after another, almost all European leaders started talking about creating their own Pentagon.

If Europe creates an independent military and technological infrastructure, the creation of a hypothetical European army, which Annalena Bärbock hinted at in Munich, will also seem, given a long-term trend, a quite feasible task: for the United States - nuclear deterrence, for Europe - the maintenance of a conventional army.

By the way, all these four global projects together cost less than 18 billion euros. Here it’s time to remember how Roscosmos, under the leadership of the now forgotten Rogozin, asked for 15 billion dollars for one such project (immeasurably weaker). Material by Valery Shiryaev.👉The link did not open? Read hereNovaya GazetaNATO needs European support. There was a lot of discussion about this at the Munich...More than 90 ministers from 40 countries gathered at the 60th anniversary Munich Security Conference that took place last weekend. It is carried out with...

description: Crews of Grad multiple launch rocket systems of the Airborne Forces destroyed Ukrainian Armed Forces personnel at a temporary deployment point on the right bank of the Dnieper in the Kherson region. The artillery constantly fires at identified targets, systematically destroying manpower and military equipment.
original:
Crews of the Grad multiple launch rocket systems of the Airborne Forces destroyed the manpower of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at a temporary deployment point on the right bank of the Dnieper in the Kherson region.

The artillery of the Airborne Forces constantly fires at identified targets in the air defense zone on the right bank of the Dnieper in the Kherson region, systematically destroying manpower and military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Crews of combat vehicles are on duty around the clock. Tasks require quick response and maximum concentration.

Having received a combat mission to destroy a Ukrainian Armed Forces unit discovered near one of the settlements on the right bank of the river, the Grad MLRS crew moved to the specified area, took up a firing position and struck at the given squares. A few seconds pass from receiving the target coordinates to the first salvo, after which an adjustment is made and a second salvo is carried out, after which a platoon of Ukrainian soldiers was destroyed, and the surviving militants hastily fled.

Target reconnaissance and adjustments are carried out by crews of unmanned aerial vehicles.

The Grad crew reloads the rocket system in reserve areas, after which it moves to new firing positions to strike newly identified targets.

description: Lawyer Viktor Patrushev was murdered in St. Petersburg due to a money dispute with businessman Ginteras Ragauskas. The killer, Andrei Artyukhin, was hired to eliminate Patrushev and mistakenly shot the lawyer's personal driver instead.
original:
The criminal investigation department detained the killer and the customer behind the murder of lawyer Viktor Patrushev in St. Petersburg. For his death, the killer was to receive 5 lyam rubles.

At the moment, employees have the following version of the criminal story, in which lawyer Viktor Patrushev was supposed to be the victim of the assassination attempt. He had a money dispute with businessman Ginteras Ragauskas. The businessman decided to end the conflict with a bullet to the forehead and turned to Andrei Artyukhin, who had previously been convicted of banditry. He had to get rid of Patrushev. Artyukhin began to follow the lawyer, studying life. He discovered that he takes the children to school No. 622 every morning in the same Toyota Camry.

On day X, he drove up to the parking lot at the right time, approached a foreign car and shot at the driver, not suspecting that it was not his target. He shot in the back, so he couldn’t see his face, and he wasn’t warned about the fact that the victim had a personal driver. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: A poem dedicated to the heroes of Avdeevka, remembering those who fought and died for their native land. The poem speaks of the bravery and sacrifice of ordinary guys who took the city by storm, crushing fascist forces and giving their lives for their Motherland.
original:
Forwarded from: AVDEEVKA.RU🇷🇺
TO AVDEEVSKY HEROES Avdeevka, when will you become peaceful,
And children's laughter will touch that day,
I ask you shamelessly persistently:
Don't forget me who died.

Don't forget us all, who this winter
Took the city by storm from scratch,
Where the sky is not depicted without smoke,
Where every step is like entering the gates of heaven.

Don't forget, ordinary guys,
Who went to his death for a handful of his native land.
Oh how many of them you have blessed,
They died heroically on the streets.

We did not die here for rewards.
Avdeevka, our Motherland has armor.
Because I crushed the fascist bastards,
Don't forget me who died.

And if I do get out of hell,
Don't let me forget among the living,
Like falling into frozen ground under the roar of a cannonade
I buried my comrades.

Avdeevka, our holy need.
We must always remember like yesterday,
How the Russian flag flew into your sky
Under our thunderous: “Uraaaaaa...”

February 17, 2024

Alexander MakarovAvdeevka.Ru🇷🇺

description: The 'Games of the Future' tournament combines physical sports and e-sports, aiming to merge the benefits of both. The event features 21 innovative disciplines, including phygital martial arts, hockey, basketball, football, racing, and skateboarding, which utilize VR/AR technology.
original:
“Games of the Future” is simple and brilliant. We tell you what phygital sports is
"Phygital" is a combination of two English words physical and digital. Thus, physical sports is the combination of classical and e-sports into a single whole.
Show more
Such a merger appeared quite recently. Therefore, even the President of Russia admitted that he has little idea how it all works:
“To be honest, I don’t really feel what it will look like, but what I saw is interesting to me. Young people are interested in these sports. And it’s good that young people are moving from computers to active activities on sports fields. All this together gives a very interesting result,”
– Putin said smiling at a meeting with the President of the Republika Srpska Milorad Dodik (he, by the way, also arrived at the opening).
In fact, the idea of physical sports is both simple and ingenious. Something like biathlon, but instead of skiing and shooting, athletes compete first in a virtual and then in a real arena.
It is known that e-sports develops reaction speed, micromotor skills, tactical and strategic thinking. At the same time, constantly sitting at a computer does not have the best effect on posture and vision. On the other hand, there is a persistent stereotype that classical athletes spend a lot of time on physical training to the detriment of mental discipline.
Thus, phygital sports aims to combine the best of both worlds. As part of the “Games of the Future,” competitions will be held in phygital martial arts, phygital hockey, phygital basketball, phygital football, phygital racing and phygital skateboarding.
The first international multi-sports tournament takes place in Kazan from February 21 to March 3, 2024 and includes 21 innovative disciplines. Each of them combines physical education and e-sports or VR/AR technology. More than 270 teams and more than 2,000 athletes from 107 countries will take part in the competition.
Not bad for an “isolated” country under sanctions, isn’t it?

description: Former CIA director and Pentagon head Robert Gates acknowledged that Russia has overcome the stalemate in the Ukrainian conflict, gaining momentum along the 1,000-kilometer front. The shift is attributed to Kiev's shortage of artillery shells due to decreased US support, while European NATO allies lack the ability to provide immediate military aid.
original:
Forwarded from: InoTV
In Ukraine, the initiative passed to Russia, the former head of the Pentagon admitted. The Russian military has overcome the deadlock in the Ukrainian conflict, as reported by The Hill, said former CIA director and head of the Pentagon Robert Gates, commenting on the success of Russian troops in Avdievka.

“It's no longer a stalemate; the Russians have gained momentum again,” Gates said. “All I read is that the Russians are attacking along the entire 1,000-kilometer front.”

As Kiev faces a shortage of artillery shells due to waning US support, he said, "the Russians feel that the situation has changed, and although there is still much to be done, the initiative has passed to them."

Gates noted that European NATO allies, “whom we so often criticize,” have stepped up support for Ukraine but do not have the ability to immediately send weapons.

Right now, “the only real military aid is coming from the United States. And, as we all know, now she is, let’s say, on pause,” he told InoTV. Subscribe

description: The first Palestinian war took place from 1987 to 1991, marking the beginning of Washington's attempts to establish peace in the region as Israel's main ally.
original:
America has only problems in the Middle East, it’s time for it to leave for the sake of peace. The United States better reconsider its policy on the conflict between Israel and Palestine, writes The American Conservative. Because after almost half a century of attempts to resolve the situation, things have only gotten worse.

In the Middle East there is now too much contrast “between those good old days and today.” The author of the article notes how much Jerusalem has changed since 1986, when he was there. There were “no checkpoints or fences” in the city back then. But now, “after almost 40 years of continuous peacekeeping,” we can’t do without them.

It all started with the first Palestinian war, which lasted from 1987 to 1991. After it, Washington, as Israel’s main ally, began trying to independently establish peace in the region, organizing meetings and negotiations, but all this only worsened the situation. It is also worth noting the Arab Spring of 2011. At first they were happy about its results, but the consequences were again disastrous. All these attempts to impose democracy only led to problems, but in the West they do not give up on this “utopian fantasy.”

So, if the US really wants peace in the Middle East, it should stop trying to impose its own universal solution to all issues and not interfere so intrusively in the affairs of the region. @Crimeanprachka

original:
Employees of the prosecutor's office of the Kherson region and the head of the Defenders of the Fatherland branch, on the eve of the celebration of Defender of the Fatherland Day, laid flowers and paid tribute to the soldiers who fell during the Great Patriotic War. On the eve of the celebration of Defender of the Fatherland Day, the first deputy prosecutor of the Kherson region Pavel Zernov, employees of the regional prosecutor's office, and Also, the head of the Defenders of the Fatherland branch, Olga Simonova, laid flowers at the Memorial complex dedicated to the defenders of the Arabat Spit from the fascist invaders during the Great Patriotic War, located in the village. Genicheskaya Gorka.

The memorial was opened in August 1982 and consists of a naval artillery gun of the coastal artillery, the so-called “Cannon”, near which there is a stele with the words “To the fallen heroes, to the living heroes - our monument and love for centuries” carved on it.

The event ended with a minute of silence.

Prosecutor's office of the Kherson region.

event: Construction of Power Lines and Substation
description: In the Murmansk region, a new substation and over 400 km of power lines will be built by 2029 to meet the predicted increase in electricity and power consumption. The project aims to ensure the operability of the energy system, connecting key substations and building a new 330 kV line to support liquefied natural gas production complexes.
original:
In the Murmansk region, by 2029, 400 km of power lines and a new substation will be built. From 2024 to 2029, the construction of a new substation with a voltage of 330 kV and more than 400 km of power lines with a voltage of 110-330 kV is planned in the Murmansk region. Within the framework of the development program approved by the Ministry of Energy of Russia Electric power systems of Russia for 2024-2029, an increase in electricity and power consumption is predicted in the Murmansk region.
According to the forecast of the System Operator, electricity consumption will reach 15.2 billion kWh by 2029, and the maximum power consumption will be 2.6 GW. To ensure the operability of the energy system, it is planned to connect the Vykhodnoy - Monchegorsk 330 kV overhead line to its own cells at the 330 kV Vykhodnoy substation and 330 kV Monchegorsk substation during the reconstruction of the corresponding substations and the creation of a second 330 kV overhead line circuit between them. It is also planned to build a 330 kV Arktika substation and a 330 kV line with a length of 358 km to ensure the production of liquefied natural gas production complexes NOVATEK-Murmansk. Planning and development of solutions, aimed at shaping the future appearance of the energy system while observing the established parameters of its reliability, are now carried out by the system operator in accordance with a new model for planning the long-term development of the industry. These changes have been made to the legislation in accordance with amendments to Federal Law No. 35-FZ “On Electric Power Industry”.@VoiceNorthSea

description: The US Next Generation Air Dominance (NGAD) program has reached a critical evaluation phase, with Pratt & Whitney completing a review of the Next Generation Adaptive Propulsion (NGAP) engine design solution with the U.S. Air Force. The next step will be ground testing the prototypes to ensure they meet design specifications before implementation into the prototype aircraft.
original: The US Next Generation Air Dominance (NGAD) program is one of the most important ongoing projects in the US military. This program aims to create a 6th generation stealth fighter that will provide air superiority over the future battlefield. Pratt & Whitney has already announced the completion of a critical evaluation phase of the Next Generation Adaptive Propulsion (NGAP) with the U.S. Air Force as part of a complete review of the NGAD engine design solution. The next step will be to ground test the prototypes to ensure they perform as originally designed before they are implemented into the as-yet-NOT-unveiled prototype aircraft. Greek army veteran and military observer Stavros Atlamazaoglu looks at what this means and what to expect in the foreseeable future. Read here. Illustration: Lockheed Martin concept showing what the 6th generation fighter will roughly look like. @yigal_levin

description: DPR employment centers provided nearly 1,500 career guidance services to young people, including schoolchildren, students, and young professionals. The services included career guidance lessons, training seminars, professional tours, and career days to help them choose in-demand professions and develop competent employment skills.
original:
Since the beginning of the year, DPR employment centers have provided nearly one and a half thousand career guidance services to young people.

Schoolchildren, students, as well as young professionals interested in changing their occupation visited employment institutions in the region.

Employment centers conduct career guidance lessons for schoolchildren, where they introduce them to in-demand professions, teach them how to correctly identify and consciously choose a future profession, taking into account the needs of the labor market.

Graduates of colleges, technical schools and universities participate in training seminars that teach competent employment: searching for information about vacancies, writing a resume, organizing a successful interview with an employer.

Career guidance specialists also have professional tours for young people to leading enterprises, quest games and quizzes, and career days.

I would like to add that this year local employers have reported to the region’s employment centers about the need for more than 5 thousand employees. In total, the employment service database contains more than 25 thousand job offers.@tolstykina_dnr

event: Using Screens Against Enemy Thermal Imaging Surveillance
description: Screens are used by snipers and observers on both sides of the conflict to evade thermal imaging surveillance. However, even basic Chinese-made thermal imaging devices can detect warm spots, which can lead to destruction if identified. Various equipment and improvised means are used as screens to hide from conventional thermal imaging means.
original:
Forwarded from: Matt SF
Using screens against enemy thermal imaging surveillance equipment It is no secret that these screens are used by snipers and observers on both sides of the conflict. How effective are they? Hiding from observation is not an easy task. Moreover, do not underestimate the enemy of any level.
Even an ordinary Chinese-made thermal imaging device can detect a “warm spot”

After its detection, the enemy will try with all his might to understand whether this spot is preventing him from calmly moving in positions or not. If identified, there will most likely be destruction.

Therefore, various elements of equipment and improvised means are used as “screens” that will not “burn” your signature against conventional thermal imaging means of general access, let’s not take into account TOD and other fancy things with cooling, in order to hide from them you need to work differently.

description: Starting September 1, carriers will be required to transfer passenger data, including bank cards, IP addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses, and account passwords, to a unified database. Airlines and AEVT have expressed concerns about data confidentiality and potential leaks.
original:
From September 1, in addition to passport and ticket data, carriers will be required to transfer data on bank cards, IP addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses and account passwords to a unified database, Kommersant has learned.

AEVT and airlines believe that some of the data is confidential information and cannot be transferred without the additional consent of the passenger. Kommersant's sources in airlines also fear data leaks and increased liability for them.

Kommersant's interlocutors close to the Ministry of Transport say that the state system is well protected, and tracking anomalies in the data will make it possible to quickly identify criminals.#Kommersant

description: The German Bundestag voted to send long-range weapons systems, specifically Taurus missiles, to Ukraine. The Taurus subsonic cruise missile has a range of up to 500 km and is designed for highly accurate engagement of enemy targets.
original:
Today, the German Bundestag voted to send long-range weapons systems to Ukraine. There were two attempts. The first, opposition resolution on the supply of Taurus missiles was not supported. And for the second, coalition, they still voted - but the decision was all the same for Olaf Scholz.

The second document specifically mentions "long-range missiles", but it is probably referring to the Taurus.

The Taurus subsonic cruise missile is designed for highly accurate engagement of enemy targets at a range of up to 500 km. This missile is similar to Storm Shadow and SCALP-EG, as they were all developed as part of a joint project.

description: The Russian Federation is indoctrinating Crimean children from the first grade, teaching them to believe they are Russian citizens, that Ukraine does not exist, and that they must defend Russia against the 'collective West'. Wounded Russian soldiers are even visiting schools to promote military action.
original:
The Russian Federation is preparing Crimean children for war against Ukraine and the “collective West” from the first grade. This was reported by Maria Sulyalina, project manager of the Almenda Center for Civic Education.

Currently, 538,674 children live in occupied Crimea. Of these, 285,963 are school-age children who must go to Russian school every day.

Through Russian textbooks, starting from the first grade, children are forced to believe that they are citizens of Russia, that Ukraine does not exist as a state, that the enemies around them are the collective West. They are being forced to believe that they must defend their state - the Russian Federation. “We recently received information that in one of the Crimean schools, wounded Russian soldiers came to first-grade children, talked about their “heroic exploits” and encouraged the children to join the action to support military personnel rf."Despite this, children remain in Crimea who continue to attend Ukrainian schools online and enroll in Ukrainian universities.

description: Law enforcement in Sevastopol detained a medical college student from Kerch for participating in a fraudulent scheme. The suspect posed as a courier, targeting three pensioners aged 73-88, and stole cash under the guise of resolving accident issues. He transferred the stolen money to current accounts and received around 100,000 rubles for his services.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
In Sevastopol, law enforcement officers detained a medical college student from Kerch for participating in a fraudulent scheme. The attacker, through one of the messengers, got a job as a courier for scammers who operated under the scheme “Your relative caused an accident.”

On the instructions of the curator, he came to Sevastopol and visited three pensioners aged from 73 to 88 years old, from whom he took cash to allegedly resolve the issue with the parties injured in the accidents and not bring their relatives to criminal liability.

The young man transferred the stolen money to current accounts, and for his illegal services he received about 100 thousand rubles, which he spent at his own discretion.

Criminal cases have been initiated against the suspect under Parts 2, 3 and 4 of Art. 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. The defendant was given a preventive measure in the form of house arrest.

description: Yandex has developed a neural network-based system to combat the consequences of ashfall from volcanic eruptions in Kamchatka. The system helps identify ash emissions and distribution areas at an early stage, enabling timely measures to mitigate the effects on infrastructure, agriculture, and wildlife.
original:
Yandex specialists have trained a neural network that fights – hold your breath – the consequences of an ashfall. Yes, a problem completely unknown to most of us has long become a real disaster for residents of some regions of our country. Volcanic eruptions in Kamchatka are not only beautiful photographs, but also very serious problems and consequences. Each such colorful outburst literally costs hundreds of millions of rubles.

What's the point? Volcanic eruptions are accompanied by active release of ash – the so-called ash fall. Black “snowflakes” sweep roads and fields. If the snowdrifts are not quickly removed, they begin to harden. Animals are left without food - and many species are actually becoming extinct due to this problem. Electricity and water supply are disrupted.

In general, the sooner measures are taken, the less critical the consequences will be - and the new Yandex service solves exactly this problem - it helps administrative services, the Ministry of Emergency Situations and geophysicists identify ash emissions and the area of its distribution at an early stage.

The service operates in the format of an interactive map. It shows how, from the moment of release, ash clouds will spread over the next 24 hours.

description: Vladimir Alekseevich Berchikov, a veteran of the Great Patriotic War, celebrated his 100th anniversary. Berchikov served as a colonel in the Ministry of Internal Affairs and was a resident of St. Petersburg.
original:
Vladimir Alekseevich Berchikov, a participant in the Great Patriotic War, colonel of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, resident of St. Petersburg, celebrated his 100th anniversary!
Vladimir Alekseevich was born on February 21, 1924 in Leningrad. After graduating from the seventh grade of the gymnasium, he entered the 8th Leningrad Special Artillery School. With the beginning
Show more
During the war, school students became part of the 270th machine gun and artillery battalion of the volunteer army of the people's militia. In August-October 1941, during fierce battles, the militia held back superior motorized enemy forces near Gatchina, defending Leningrad. From the first days of the blockade, the surviving students were returned to school. In February 1942, the school was evacuated, and Vladimir Berchikov was sent to a short-term course for junior lieutenants in the city of Rybinsk, after which he commanded a platoon and then a company in the 183rd Rifle Division. In the most difficult battles near Rzhev he was wounded and spent nine months in a military hospital in the city of Gorky (now Nizhny Novgorod).
In June 1943, he began serving as a local police commissioner in the city of Slobodskaya, Kirov Region. In 1944, he was sent to operational work in the Estonian SSR and soon headed the criminal investigation department of Tallinn. The young operative has many solved crimes, including terrorist ones. In August 1946, the head of the Harjuma criminal investigation department, V.A. Berchikov, was rewarded by order of the commander of the North Baltic Fleet, Admiral V.F. Tributs, for his active assistance in solving serious crimes against naval personnel. He devoted more than 40 years of his life to serving in the police in responsible positions in various regions of the country: Tallinn, Odessa, Leningrad, including in educational institutions of the USSR Ministry of Internal Affairs. In 1983, he resigned from the post of deputy head of the Leningrad Special Secondary Police School of the USSR Ministry of Internal Affairs and became chairman of the veterans' organization. Colonel. In 2007, Vladimir Alekseevich was elected to the Council of Veterans of the St. Petersburg University of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia, where he actively participates in the patriotic education of youth.
He was awarded the highest award of the ministry - “Honored Worker of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the USSR”.
Awarded the Order of the Patriotic War, 1st degree; medals: “For Military Merit”, “For the Defense of Leningrad”, “For the Defense of Moscow”, “For the Victory over Germany in the Great Patriotic War of 1941–1945”, “Veteran of Labor”, other medals and memorial signs.
#LiveVoice of Victory

description: Google's Gemini chatbot faced criticism for its approach to race, creating inaccurate images and refusing to show white people. The bot aimed to increase racial diversity, but led to historical inaccuracies and absurd results. Google acknowledged the issue, attributing it to a developer error, and promised to improve the tool.
original:
Google has promised to fix its AI chatbot after accusations that it refuses to show white people and acknowledge their role in history. Previously, a new version of the Gemini chatbot was criticized on social networks due to its approach to race. Initially, users noticed that even in standard queries he created images that were aimed at increasing “racial diversity.” This led to historical inaccuracies. For example, when searching for “Founding Fathers of the United States,” the bot returned images of blacks, indigenous peoples, and Asians, although it is common knowledge that they were white Americans. The bot’s efforts to increase racial diversity led to absurd results—for example, it created images of “Nazis” that also included representatives of national minorities.

When the AI was already specifically asked to show an image of a white person, Gemini refused to comply with the requests because they "reinforced harmful stereotypes and generalizations about people based on their race." At the same time, it created exactly the same images with any other race (the bot agreed to create images of black scientists, but not white ones). When Gemini asked why depicting a white person was “harmful,” the bot argued that focusing on race reduces people to individual characteristics, something that has previously been used to “justify oppression and violence against marginalized groups.”

Amid criticism, Google said its tool "misses the mark." Jack Krawczyk, senior director of Gemini Experiences, admitted that due to a developer error, the bot created inaccurate images. “We are working to improve images like this immediately,” he added. At the moment, Gemini is refusing some tasks, ignoring historical queries like “Vikings” (previously the bot created them as black), “Nazis in Germany in the 30s”, “US President in 1800”.

description: The Sevastopol Aquarium, damaged by a November storm, has reopened its Hall 3 after completing internal repairs, replacing destroyed equipment, and conducting a thorough cleaning. Although the storm killed around 800 animals, the aquarium plans to restore its tropical fish collection by May 9.
original:
#News@mpre_view1
The hall of the Sevastopol Aquarium, damaged by the November storm, has reopened. However, they plan to completely restore the collection of tropical fish destroyed by the hurricane by May 9, the director told (https://pdmnews.ru/35465/) the publication “Podyom”
Show more
the oldest aquarium-museum in Russia Yuri Kravtsov.
“We completed all the internal work in Hall 3, repaired the aquariums that were destroyed, replaced the destroyed equipment, put some of the animals in the aquarium and did a thorough cleaning. And today we opened and invite everyone.
The storm killed approximately 800 animals. We haven't restored the collection yet. We have already planted some of the animals that were provided to us by the Evpatoria Aquarium and the Moscow Oceanarium for the exhibition, and some of the animals, about 300, are still in the laboratory, they are growing up, acclimatizing, and already during the work of the museum we will plant them in portions. I think that by May 9, that’s the date, we will have completely restored the animal collection.”
Kravtsov added that the aquarium also needs to repair the gates and roof; this work will begin after the end of the storm period on April 1.
A powerful hurricane hit the Black Sea coast at the end of November. Strong waves punched a hole in the roof of the Sevastopol Aquarium, because of which cold water flooded the hall with tropical animals, most of them died (https://t.me/pdmnews/65087) immediately, the rest received hypothermia. The damage from the rampant disaster in the museum was estimated (https://t.me/pdmnews/65188) at 2.3 million rubles.

description: The RBU missile system, used as an ersatz replacement for multiple launch rocket systems, has significant disadvantages. Its wild dispersion of shells at ranges of 5-6 kilometers and difficult reloading in field conditions make it ineffective. The system's precision is questionable, with individual shells arriving almost half a kilometer from each other, making it unsuitable for defeating fortified positions or equipment.
original:
Using a microscope on nails.

We have already written about the “effectiveness” of RBU as an ersatz replacement for multiple launch rocket systems and standard means of reinforcing companies and battalions. Last time we pointed out the main disadvantages of this solution: the wild dispersion of shells at ranges of 5-6 kilometers and extremely difficult reloading in field conditions. If you can be patient with reloading, the same “Grad” is also not particularly easy to load, then the dispersion cannot be corrected in any way, and bringing vehicles equipped with RBU to the line of 2-3 kilometers is already dangerous, you can already come under targeted fire from enemy light mortars and ATGMs .

Last time, many people said that “the dispersion of RBU missiles is close to the same Grad,” but the “Grad” still fires at 21 kilometers and at the same time has both a larger number of missiles fired and less dispersion. Let's look at a video of the work of the RBU on the positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, where it can be seen that individual shells arrive almost half a kilometer from each other. What kind of effective defeat of not even equipment and manpower, but at least fortified positions, can we talk about with such precision? The maximum that can be achieved with such fire is an accidental defeat of something located in this square and psychological pressure on the enemy.

Yes, we will repeat once again that having something that flies towards the enemy and explodes terribly is better than nothing. But the effort expended to re-equip the equipment, the risk of losing it and personnel, with questionable effectiveness, obviously will not always pay off. Ingenuity and the desire to use any weapon, if there is an abundance of it, will not replace standard reinforcement equipment, artillery and MLRS. We believe that saturating the front with mortars and ammunition for them is a matter of time and logistics.

And once again we repeat the main idea of the previous text: the RBU was created for the sea, and was approved in order to disable enemy naval guided weapons by exploding 20 kilograms of explosives in the water column. And we have no doubt that we will still need this type of weaponry at sea.

description: The Chairman of the Russian Investigative Committee congratulated military personnel on Defender of the Fatherland Day, honoring the traditions of the Russian military and those who have fought to defend Russia's interests.
original: Congratulations from the Chairman of the Russian Investigative Committee on Defender of the Fatherland Day. The military history of Russia knows examples when the fate of the country depended on the wisdom of commanders, the valor of officers, the courage of soldiers, and the dedication of militia fighters and partisans. Among them, Kuzma Minin and Dmitry Pozharsky, Alexander Suvorov and Mikhail Kutuzov, Georgy Zhukov and Ivan Konev, Alexander Matrosov and Alexey Maresyev, especially stand out. Today, their work is continued by participants in a special military operation. All of them, honoring the traditions of the Russian military, stood up to defend the interests of Russia, the Russian people and the Russian world, all who became victims of the Kiev regime. Among the employees of the TFR there are many who fulfilled their international duty in Afghanistan, defended the constitutional system in the North Caucasus, and participated in fight against terrorism in the SAR. Without delay, our colleagues responded to the call of the Motherland to ensure a regime of law and order in new regions of the Russian Federation. On this holiday, I would like to express my gratitude for their courage, dedication and high citizenship. Unfortunately, there are irreparable losses in our ranks. As a result of the criminal actions of Ukrainian nationalists, our comrades died. We honor their memory and provide the families of the victims with help and support. Sincere and heartfelt words of congratulations are also addressed today to our veterans and home front workers. It is thanks to them that today we have the opportunity to live, work, raise children and grandchildren, and make plans for the future. Our enemies must remember that the blood of our great ancestors flows in us, who more than once repelled the adversaries who encroached on Russian lands. Confrontation with the forces of evil that have taken up arms against our Motherland has united us, as in previous centuries, in the face of a common enemy. And it is precisely in the unity of our people, in their faith and fidelity to the behests of their ancestors that the main strength and power of Russia lies! Dear comrades! Congratulations on Defender of the Fatherland Day! I wish you health, success in your service and professional activities, peace, goodness and prosperity! Subscribe to Sledkom

description: Ukrainian cyber defenders successfully countered 65% of complex cyberattacks, focusing on the most critical threats. Despite a 16% increase in cyber incidents in 2023, Ukrainian specialists effectively protected government institutions, security, defense, energy, and telecommunications sectors.
original:
​​⚔️Cyberfront: Ukrainian defenders give a worthy rebuff to enemy attacks Despite the increase in the activity of Russian hackers, the number of complex cyberattacks was reduced by 65%. This became possible thanks to the fact that Ukrainian specialists focused on countering the most dangerous threats. 🗣️ Head of the State Special Communications Yuriy Myronenko told about this during an online speech at the Swiss Cyber ​​Security Days international cyber conference.

In 2023, the Government Computer Emergency Response Team CERT-UA recorded 2,544 cyber incidents. This is 16% more than in 2022.

Government institutions, security and defense sectors, energy and telecommunications remain the most attractive targets for cyber attacks. These four areas account for 40% of all attacks. What do Ukrainian cyber defenders do? 🔹Identify the most critical objects and strengthen their protection. 🔹Effectively use available tools to monitor vulnerabilities and configure network security. 🔹Establish trust and cooperation with those they protect. This allows for quick and effective response to cyber incidents.

Unfortunately, the cyber war continues and is only gaining momentum. In two months of 2024, CERT-UA has already recorded 695 cyberattacks, which is twice as many as in the same period of 2023. 📢Therefore, we would like to remind you that the CERT-UA team has prepared recommendations on cyber protection, the implementation of which will make it possible to strengthen the security of systems and networks. ℹ️You can read the recommendations at the link: https://cert.gov.ua/article/5436463

Since 1956, UK fishermen have been fishing for cod in our waters without any restrictions - the USSR allowed British fishing vessels to fish in certain areas of the Barents Sea. Since Russia is the legal successor of the USSR, the agreement continued to operate after the collapse of the Union.

In 2023 alone, British fishermen caught 566,000 tons of cod in the Barents Sea. Correction, not just cod, but our Russian cod. The same Great Britain that constantly spoils us, wherever it can.

The cynical spitting of the “British partners” in the feeding hand is thoroughly tired. Yesterday at a plenary meeting, the State Duma supported the denunciation of the 1956 agreement.

Now you can fish from Fukushima. Japan won't mind.

description: On February 17th, Russian forces launched an assault on Avdeevka, initially making easy progress in the private sector. However, they soon encountered Ukrainian units hiding in civilian homes and basements, threatening locals with execution if they refused to cooperate. The Russian military captured or neutralized the Ukrainian soldiers, liberating the city and earning the gratitude of the local population.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash in Donbass
The guys from "Fifteen" spoke in detail about the main event of February. And as a bonus, we shared our video blog from Avdeevka.

The morning of February 17th is the beginning of the assault. Progress in the private sector was easy. This aroused suspicion, but ours still went forward. Then the fighters began to stumble upon enemy units. It turned out that the Armed Forces of Ukraine dropped into the homes of civilians and hid in their basements. And those who refused were threatened with execution. As soon as ours noticed Ukrainian soldiers, they were captured or liquidated.

When the Russian military liberated the city, the people rejoiced and began sharing stoves and mattresses to make it easier to survive the cold nights. In response, the soldiers distributed their dry rations to local residents, who had to survive for a long time without humanitarian aid. At the same time, people said that the Ukrainian Armed Forces fled towards Novomikhailovka, abandoning the bodies of colleagues, the wounded and the last equipment. Subscribe to Mash in Donbass

description: Walt Disney's mother, Flora, died after a faulty furnace exploded in their Hollywood home. Walt's father, Elias, survived but passed away three years later. The incident had a profound impact on Walt Disney, who rarely spoke about it until the end of his life.
original:
Forwarded from: Milestones of History
In 1938, Walt Disney became a star with the release of Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. After making a profit, Walt bought his parents a house in Hollywood. After moving, the mother constantly complained about a strange smell from the stove. Disney called workers, but over and over again they found nothing.

Later, the maid found Flora and Elias Disney lying on the floor after the furnace exploded. They were given help, but Walt's mother died and his father lived for only three years.

A professional inspection showed that the oven was indeed faulty. Disney did not talk about his parents until the end of his life and had a very difficult time with this event.Subscribe

The youth were praised for their volunteer efforts during the pandemic and in Donbass, with over 3,500 Young Guard members participating in the party's humanitarian mission.
original:
Another meeting in Birobidzhan - with the youth activists of United Russia: secretaries of the primary organizations, activists of MGER and the regional branch, supporters of the party.

Our youth are the vanguard of the volunteer movement. During the pandemic, they were the first to come to the aid of people - they helped doctors, were on duty in Covid hospitals, delivered food, and worked in call centers.

When the Northern Military District began, they were again the first to go to Donbass. Expand gum centers. Over two years, more than 3.5 thousand Young Guard members went through the party’s humanitarian mission.

The party “youth team” often becomes the beginning of a long political journey. There are many examples of this. Last year alone, nearly three hundred MGER activists became deputies at various levels in the regions. There are also such examples in the Jewish Autonomous Region.

These guys have already decided on their choice in life. And in the presidential elections they will not leave their vote “under the pillow” or somewhere else. They will come and vote. For Russia, for its future. For victory. For our President.

description: Spanish newspaper El Periodico published a scan of the fake passport of Maxim Kuzminov, a traitor who stole a Russian Mi-8 helicopter and defected to Ukraine. The passport, created by Ukrainian forgers, listed Kuzminov's residence as Donetsk in the Donbass region.
original:
☠️El Periodico: traitors have no face The Spanish newspaper El Periodico published a scan that was probably taken from the fake passport of the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, who stole a Mi-8 helicopter of the Russian Armed Forces in the Ukrainian-Reich. The Ukrainian creators of fake documents mockingly “settled” Mr@z in the Donbass, in Donetsk.

I noticed an interesting fact. To denote the scoundrel’s face, not the word “face” is used, but the word “fisonomía” (“face”). Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: Hieromonk Feofan, a priest from Donetsk, cautioned Ivleeva against visiting the DPR to boost her reputation. Instead, he suggested she take a nursing course and work in a hospital to make a meaningful contribution.
original:
A priest from Donetsk, Hieromonk Feofan, advised Ivleeva not to come to the DPR in order to improve her reputation.
If the blogger really wants to do something, then, according to the priest, she should take a nursing course and come to work in a hospital.
